text: my god after trying this place once i decided to give it another go and the food here is fucking gross as hell damn shame.

What a treat.....This pub was amazing. From the eggs benedict to the best burgers in town to the fish tacos ending the day with nachos and smores out on their patio around the fire pit! Great atmosphere!!!!! Can't wait to return New Years weekend.

ITS OKAY!  A nice pub serving British dishes. I've been there a couple times. Fish and chips are a great choice. Bangers and mash, sausage was flavorless and mushy and peculiar. Corned beef sliders are a good choice. Shepard's pie was great one time I had it, not so good other times. Inconsistencies exist here. As far as service goes, if you get the younger guy serving you, he doesn't get your order right and you will wait for your drinks.  ASK HIM TO WRITE DOWN YOUR ORDER, it's your experience, not his. He talks too much and forgets he is there to serve you and he may think your there to see him.  With the coupons they consistently send out, I will come back for the fish and chips.  I just need to know what days that server is off.
Come here regularly for trivia and music bingo. The food is great and they have a large beer selection.  ANDRE is an amazing and knowledgeable server.

Our first visit here. Hubs had shepherds pie and I their fish & chips. My husband thought  his dinner was pretty good, & I thought mine was good, too. The homemade coleslaw that came with my dish was very good! 
Will come here again - good atmosphere and good food...and drink!
Don't bother going here to watch the Soccer game the whole bar has already been reserved we all left...very disappointed...

Burger heaven! Service is awesome when Megan is here...food is great..Megan was friendly, attentive and knows her beers...doesn't hurt that she is pleasant on the eyes as well...definitely have to try the burgers! CHEERS!
Kerri and Tiffini are fantastic!! Just go here, eat the fish and chips and drink Guinness. It will just make you happy!!!

I just moved to Henderson and searched for a local British Pub as soon as I could.. When I saw this one offered trivia and was called Shakespeare's  I was double excited. I had so high hopes...which were quickly squashed.. Where to begin... The service was terrible , I mean piss poor attitudes, pretentious snobbery , just plain rude.. How to servers, bartenders, and hostesses of a pub come to have such high regard for themselves and such low regard for their customers .One of the things a pub is known for is their love for their customers, that warm and fuzzy feeling that everyone knows your name..or at least wants to learn it. sigh, maybe i watch too much CHEERS 

So where was I, our waiter was an ass. Our food was disgusting.. meat skewers that looked like mini meat skewers..So tiny and dried up ..They were completely inedible..I would have told our server to take them back, if he had ever came back to out table.. I was pretty sad and wanted to leave but then trivia began , it was hosted by some woman who just downloaded everything from a site and sat at a booth and ate while sloooowly going through the questions and answers..giving all the tables plenty of time to get the answers off their phones. She was too busy eating and flirting with all the managers to even check for cheaters.  
Shakespeare would be rolling in his grave

What a nice surprise.  A friend recommended this place. They went because of a coupon, loved the fish and chips.  We waited and couldn't find a coupon but had to go anyway and they were so right.  Not only was the fish and chips great, It was huge.  The Ruben sandwich was the best I've had    Wow.  You gotta go.
The food is amazing but the service is incredible. Jorge the server is upbeat fun and keeps the drinks coming! He is by far the best waiter we have ever had.

Very good beer selection, dart board, pool table, friendly staff, quiet ambience (no loud music).
Potato wedges with curry are adictive.  
Steak and mushroom pie is very good. 
Shepperds pie is good. 
Chicken curry and veggies is OK,

I want this to be a completely fair review. I write reviews for several websites as a destination expert and rarely reveal that fact. I have never written a Yelp review but this will be my first.  Our demographic is that we are local, retired, professionals probably not the crowd usually served by Shakespeare's. Today we decided to try lunch at Shakespeare's Grille and Pub. I few months ago we tried dinner and found a delightful array of beers, a casual atmosphere, and knowledge staff. We felt very welcomed as we experienced the menu and sampled a couple of the beers recommended. The waiter was a fountain of information about various brews both seasonal and standard. He had a wealth of knowledge regarding imports as well. 

That evening we tried several offerings but the stand out was the crispy golden fish and chips. The fish was perfectly fried with a nice batter coating that was neither too thick or two thin. The chips were crispy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. The cole slaw was a very nice portion and had a nice dressing that was tangy, sweet, and not overly sauced with mayonnaise. 

Today we visited for lunch and the experience was horrid. When we pulled up we noticed a unkempt looking smallish fellow sleeping in the patio area. We were running a few errands and had our little dog with us when we decided to stop for a quick lunch. We are very skilled in fostering animals and treat our own as a much loved member of the family. We often travel with our little dog and he is ever so spoiled. We expected to be in the business no more than 30 minutes. We intermittently run the air conditioner for the dog and have remote access to do so and we take turns checking on him every 10 minutes for the short time we are in dispose. This seemed reasonable on a day with the temperature being 67 degrees and his kennel was in the shade. After the first 10 minutes I went outside to start the air conditioning.  I was met by a lady who seemed genuinely concerned that there was a dog inside the car and unattended. I do understand that people can make judgments out of concern which may not be compatible with facts. I explained that he is very much attended and thanked her for her concern.  At that point the young man began spewing angry, and ill informed opinions about how we cared for our much loved companion. An animal companion who has traveled the nation in this same car with adoring care from his owners. The young man continued to escalate and nothing could convince him that he was incorrect in his judgment. At that point it was clearly an excuse to be angry, venomous, insulting, and abusive with no real concern for the animal. He might have originally been well meaning but he became bizarre.  There are not enough lines to express how vulgar, ignorant, and abusive his affect and language became. This included repeating that he hoped the dog died. Strange words for someone supposedly concerned for animal welfare.

It turns out that this young man entered Shakespeare's when he cooled slightly. His affect was completely different and it was Jekyll to Hyde scary. He was confronted about his behavior and he casually denied any responsibility and that was the end of that. I was so concerned for the safety of our dog and our car that I couldn't return to the dining area at all. I sat in the car and my husband as my surrogate discussed the situation with the waitress. She stated that the fellow was one of there "best players". I  don't know if that is pool, trivia, bar top poker, or something else but he was clearly representing an important asset to the bar. 

I did have my meal to go and again the fish and chips are noteworthy. The food here is good. I wish I could honestly offer a four start review. I can not.. There are many nicer places to go where you can feel safe. I do hope this experience is not representative of their core base of customers. Beware if you venture into this type of situation that it is very unpleasant to be unprotected by an establishment from this sort of erratic behavior. They may have indeed acted if it had occurred inside their space  where it was witnessed instead of on the patio.

It is for the sake of future diners that we will call the owner to discuss the experience. I doubt that we will ever return. This was  twilight zone dining.

I have been the past two Wednesdays with friends for their pub quiz. The service is very good. The few servers are overwhelmed a bit with the crowds for trivia, but they make the extra effort to get things taken care of. The trivia is a fair challenge, the questions are generally a bit dated, but there is a ok mix of topics. The 3 stars comes from the food and drink prices. Domestic drafts were $4 and most meals were over $12 and not more than basic bar food. Otherwise, this is a fun spot for Wednesday night.

Excellent, we strolled in for Brunch/Breakfast and Sunday Funday Football. The service was friendly and knowledgeable. They cleaned the table for us immediately, before we sat down. The items we ordered were cooked to perfection. The TV's weren't too loud, but loud enough to enjoy the games... I LOVE THIS PLACE=GREAT ATMOSPHERE AND GREAT FOOD!  It was our first time going for breakfast and we will definitely be back.....THANKS!

Jaime was great.  She was patient with us, being first time customers.  Love the beer selection.  Ordered mac and cheese and fish and chips on her recommendation.  The mac and cheese was awesome. The fish and chips needed some salt and was good.  Also had a Reuben sandwich, which was great.  Some might not agree because all the fat wasn't trimmed off.  Got there early so it wasn't busy. As it got closer to 7pm and trivia time, it got busier and we had to wait for our server to bring us the check. Will be coming back.

The food is good. But the main reason ad came back is because if the superior service by Jorge.  He remembered us the second time we came in.  Even remembered the wine we like. Wonderful personality. Very professional. He could train the wait staff. We will make this a regular stop.
Really good British food. The poutine fries were really good as were the lamb sliders. We will be back!

Always a great experience coming here!!!! Been here a few times including 2 comedy nights and all were fun times. André is an AWESOME server there, knows his beer like no other and always helpful!! The owner is nice as well! Great food!! Amazing drinks!!! My new hangout place ;)
I would recommend giving this place a try. Nice staff, nice environment. It was karaoke night and everybody had a good time.

How sad!!  The food here used to be great, but alas, no longer tis' so.  Stopped by to say bye to the bartender leaving for New Zealand, only to find he had been fired!  The Guinness BBQ wings used to be delicious, but now they just taste like plain old bad BBQ.  The fish and chips was once really 'the best in town', now it looks and tastes like the frozen Gorden's fisherman's fish from the grocery store.  Unbelievably the Guinness didn't even taste right!  It's better out of a can!!!  Not sure what happened but with the original staff gone and the food now very poor and substandard...sorry to say we won't be back!

I went here for St Patricks day after going to their website to see what they had going on.
 
Their site showed that they had a St Patty's day celebration with live music. It also showed they had happy hour DAILY and buy one dinner get one 50% off. We thought it would be a good place to have a beer or two and eat an early dinner.  When we arrived we found out that there was a $10 cover, no happy hour and no dinner discounts.  I would call that false advertisement.

We decided to stay since we had people meeting us but the place sucked. Even if we didn't have to pay the cover and got the discount I wouldn't go back. I'm from England so may have pretty lofty expectations as far as the food in concerned but it wasn't even close to authentic and the beers were coming out 75% full.  Unacceptable!

The new owners have done a great job turning the place into a good spot to hang out. One of the better beer selections in town and events on most nights keep this place pretty busy. Food is above average but nothing to write home about. Typical English pub fare. Give it a shot and see if it is for you.

Nice place. The first time I went I had a hard time finding it. It is in a strip mall but then most of Vegas is. Food = good, beer selection = good, dog friendly patio = good, friendly staff = good... What more could you ask for?

Wow, sad to say this place has plummeted since we last visited.  Came on a Saturday early evening during NBA playoffs and the place was virtually empty (first clue).  The beer selection is still good, however the food we had was poorly cook and over oily/greasy (second clue).  The waiter was "pushing" the fish and chips (which we couldn't find on the menu so it must have been something special for that night) Had the sampler platter, eeech.  I thought the chicken tenders were the fish they were cooking and mistakenly been put on our platter.  Nope, called the waiter over, we cut the strip open and, indeed, it was chicken.  HOWEVER, I asked him to smell it and tell me with a straight face that it didn't wreak of fish.  He agreed and said the cook must have cooked it in the same oil as the fish because oil is expensive (third clue). WHAT?  that's not my problem, who the heck cooks anything in oil that fish has been cooked in.  Anyway, the waiter said he would replace it and came back relatively quickly with a nice big juicy looking tender.  I cut it open and it was raw in the middle (final straw).  OK, we're done with this place, finished our beers and left for the last time.

HUGE beer selection, GREAT service and staff, affordable prices and they always have something going on to enjoy (Karaoke Fridays are my personal favorite). Also, their food is really good! I was a bit hesitant at first (generally I'm not a fan of pub food), but they have a lengthy menu with some pretty tasty dishes (try the poutine!)

Check it out sometime. It's a blast.
I adore this place.  The lamb sliders or shepherd pie are my favorites.  Trivia night, comedy night or karaoke night, any night you go will be amazing!

I stopped in at this "pub" for a pint of beer last night. When the foam settled on my Boddington's, it was only about three quarters of a glass of beer. The waitress came around to ask if we wanted another round, I replied that I had been shorted the first time. She responded that they always pour them that way. I'll going for a full pint somewhere else next time.

I thought this was a non smoking place per advertising? Otherwise, I would have NEVER gone in!
I asked a smoker to put cigarette out & she didn't. I asked Bartender & he ignored me & then stating after certain time it's ok to smoke??? Is impression they gave. The 2 Bartenders there were rude & WOW especially the filthy woman Bartender! Unfortunately I was rude back. Point is if woman who just kept smoking would have put her cigarette out, then no problem. Us non smokers go there because it's SUPPOSED to be NON smoking. Jeff & Shannon are adorable & great Bartenders! I usually go there with group of non smoking friends & if they smoke they go outside. I'm totally wrong if smoking is aloud. I hadn't been there for while so maybe I didn't get memo.
I apologized to the woman Bartender for asking the woman to put cigarette out & stated she was a Bitch for continuing to smoke like she was so entitled. She (Bartender) called me a fucking cunt loud. So I went to her stupid level & then left. I wasn't bothering anyone.
I just wanted (to my knowledge) was non smoking place.

Googled English pub's and found Shakespeare's.  The waitress was super friendly and the Sausage rolls were Brilliant. I would also recommend the Fish & Chips. Great atmosphere, especially if you are a sports fan, which I am not. We will be back again!

This charming little gastropub might be a bit out of the way for some (and you can't immediately see it by driving either down Eastern Ave or Coronado so do Mapquest it first) but it's worth the search- a pub that combines the best parts of both a British and Irish Pub experience, including a Wednesday pub quiz, pool/dart areas and a couch area with fireplace and flat-screen TV just above it for a rustic venue to watch your footie or the NFL on. In good weather, you can even sit outside but we've never been here when it's been cool (or non-windy) enough to do so. 

The owner used to be the general manager of Fado Irish Pub on Eastern before it (sadly) closed and has brought much of the quality food preparation and wide beer and spirits selection along with him to this now British-predominant place. One of the best aspects in the bar area is one of those personal tap-tables with riser seats that allows you and 4-5 of your friends to pour your own Guinness or Harp while it keeps track of the pints drawn (and very accurately, too, down to the 100th decimal point!) Service has been good each time we've gone, too- not hovering but close by if you need something. 

The food is definitely of good quality, the presentation is great and not that expensive for the portion size and quality. The fish and chips portion is large and very good, the Shepherd's Pie is well-made and presented, bangers and mash are traditionally served and the corned beef sandwich is not made from sliced, round corned beef logs like at some other places, but from a true, uneven brisket piece. And did I mention the traditional British breakfast with all the right sausages and baked beans? They also have great hamburgers and salads, ideal for those who want British/Irish alcohol but not the cuisine that goes along with it (their loss, in my opinion...we've never had a bad meal of traditional British food here.)  

The ambience could be better, which is why it only gets four stars. Shakespeare's was not the first tenant of this space and they seem to have inherited a large portion of the old tables/chairs and room design, not all of which makes it look much like a British pub except for some posters and Guinness/Harp advertisements on the walls. But the casual tables-and-chairs set-up has its advantages if you have a group of friends who want to watch sports on any of their many TV's, for example, and the brickwork on some of the pillars gives it a bit of an Old World feel.

All in all, if you miss the old Fado (either on Eastern or when it was in Green Valley Ranch years ago), this is not a bad replacement. Even if there's more stress on Britain than Ireland now, they still serve an awesome pint of Harp to go with their steak and mushroom pie, and that's really all that matters.

The server was attentive and gave suggestions. We both had fish and chips, they were OK a little greasy, and over priced, no mushy peas (darn). Next time I'll try the bangers and mash. Beer selection was good

Came in on a Saturday afternoon and pub was relatively quiet service was friendly and fast however food is utterly disgusting. Potato wedges with fish ,not chips or even french fries. over cooked highly processed sausages. Ive tasted better pototoes out of boxes and  potatoes previously frozen large ass fish fingers (battered cod).#fail

I ordered delivery to my hotel room and it arrived within 30 minutes. It came perfectly warm. The fries were still crisp and the bread on my reuben was not soggy.  The food was amazing. Everything I expected. As someone who spends a lot of time in England, the food was very comforting. My props to the cook, and the delivery guy was very nice.

Nice, but not wonderful, selection of beer. The Guinness BBQ sauce covered wings were very good. The Caesar salad good, but also nothing special. The live music from the Killian's Angels was very good.

I used to go regularly to catch their karaoke show and it was great for a long time. Then slowly it stated to get over-run with a much older crowd. Like, it almost felt like a senior center was loading up a bus and bringing it in. Seriously, I think they may have been telling them it was an AARP meeting. hahahah... It was weird! So I found another place to patronize for karaoke. At a later date, I went back to see if things had improved. As I like the location, it is smoke free, and the staff was always pretty good. But, Shakespeare's has apparently burnt ties with some of the better karaoke brands in town and at this point they use some horrible karaoke service by the name of 'Kool Katz'. (OMG!) In short it's like three middle aged men hosting karaoke: that have the social skills and social depth of teen boys. They run the karaoke queue by putting themselves and their friend through the queue faster. They obviously need the power trip of being in charge of something, so karaoke does it for them. Not to mention they aren't very skilled with the audio engineering portions of the job so it doesn't sound very good compared to many of the other karaoke brands in town. I won't be back for karaoke there until I am sure they find a better option.

Hands down, best bar I've EVER been too. Literally no comparison when it comes to that one spot you go after a long day at work. 

Friendly staff (I.e Sidney, Jorge, Shannon, Corey). Always accomadating. I also love that whenever I have a fresh idea for a new drink, Shannon is on point! The selections that Joaquin and Shannon have are simply amazing! 

The food is as equally delicious as the beer selection. If you're looking for an inexpensive version of yard house, this is your place to go. 20 beers on tap, and 101 bottles. The food is also very Irish/British based. The chicken tenders are my ultimate favorite. 

Also, if you're looking for a hotspot that has something going on every night of the week, Shakespeare's has got you covered. Each day of the week there is a something going on. Thursday nights are ladies nights. Your very first drink is FREE! That's right FREE. Comedy night on Mondays is always great as well, I absolutely love Charlie!

Horrible service for a Friday night.
Took forever for a menu/drinks, etc!
Will never be back.
Saw others leave because they never got service.

I have only ever eaten outside on a cool day with my dog. The fish and chips were the best I have ever had (and I travel a great deal). I like the clean and decorated interior, and the excellent service will bring me back again and again. Support your local businesses! These people are doing it right!
This place is not cool to go gamble. I put In 70 dollars and got charged for the one beer i had, last time I go there

Had the fish fry for our first visit. It was the best fish fry we have had anywhere in Las Vegas in almost 20 years. Crispy on the outside, flaky and moist on the inside. We see so many places advertise they have the best fish fry, but this one lives up to it's claim. Shelley, our server was very helpful and pleasant. We will be back.

Went with a large group of people on a Saturday night for dinner and drinks. I had the cheeseburger and fries special for $8. The burger was really good and was pretty big. The bad news was they did not have Harp or Bass on tap which is weird for a pub to not at least have one of those so you can do a Black and Tan or Half and Half. The drinks were a bit pricey for a local pub but it seems like everywhere now has upped the alcohol prices. All in all a very nice local place with a good vibe.

This was a huge disappointment, but I think my problem may have stemmed from the fact that I ordered Mexican food from a British pub. But how can you mess up fish tacos? And my husbands burger was "tasteless and dry". He made the bonehead move of ordering American food at a British pub. So maybe we should have ordered fish and chips?
The food & service was great! Our server, Jorge, was very attentive. I had the fish & chips and Judy had the blackened salmon. Both were excellent!
It's a pub with great beer selection (a group of friends were doing beer tasting), great wings and friendly bartender! What else do you need from a pub? :-)

I will be moving to this side of town and was introduced to this pub through my papa! He actually just moved here and found this place while wondering one day. It is actually a realllly nice bar and grille. I almost bought one of their t-shirts, maybe next time though. The bartender was really nice to us. He was always checking in and chit chattin away. I enjoyed his company. 

I had the Shakespeare Sliders, and when it says comes with fries, its more like comes with amazing potato wedges! So delicious!! 

They also have this neat table in the middle of the bar where you can have like a drinking party! It has a keg underneath and 2 or 3 taps on top to pour your own beer. It has a meter attached to it, so you pay as much as you drink. I have never actually seen that before. I thought it was neat, could just be me and my little knowledge of brewery shenanigans.

They are HUGE rugby fans too! So awesome! I think I am going to enjoy this little pub in the corner! 

:)

Good food, good beer and even better service. All the servers/bartenders are great but you have to 
see Andre when you come in, he's undoubtedly the very best! He's on top of it for sure, you won't be disappointed!!

I have gone here a couple times for pub trivia.  The ambiance and decor provide for a great pub atmosphere.  Very spacious dining and bar area.  If I lived in the area I would definitely drop by for some of the premier league soccer games.  The premier league banners on the wall give the bar an atmosphere that is different from the standard cookie cutter sports bar.

Drinks are reasonably priced and mixed drinks are well made.  I've never had a beer there, but the selection looks pretty diverse and would appeal to beer aficionados.  The food is largely pub classics.  The battered chicken tenders are good and rate up there with some of the better chicken tenders in the Las Vegas bars.  The sausage rolls with aioli mustards are an excellent appetizer to share and were good as well.  There is not an item on the food menu that you would think of and say I have to go to this bar.  In fairness, that statement is true for 99% of the bar food in Las Vegas.

What really makes this place four stars is the service and friendly owners.  the staff goes out of their way to make your bar experience a quality one.  Somewhere John Taffer would be very happy.

i tried to order online using Postmates , they canceled " my order twice after accepting the orders (Shakespeare's not Postamtes  ) , i spent an hour trying to order from them .  if you can not handle online orders do not sign up for those services .

I'm a fan, mostly because the lack of other options near by. Very comfortable place to watch the proper football, food is good but a bit on the pricey side for what you get.

I've yet to eat anything I haven't enjoyed and the staff has always been friendly.

I come in purely to watch the games and always have had a good time, the TVs are nice and they show all the games throughout.

The food is great here!  This was our first time here and I got the fish and chips.  The fish was perfectly fried and the steak fries were awesome.  My wife got the Reuben and it was piled high with hot and tender corned beef and sweet sour kraut.  We will definitely be back.

I am so bummed with the quality of the food, we couldn't eat it! We usually love the food, but tonight is another story.... We got our delivery in a timely manner. Super excited to eat my side salad and Mac and Cheese. They were BOTH INEDIBLE!! My salad was wilted and filled with brown pieces. My MAC and Cheese was gross. It was like they are using the cheap, fake cheese in it! Half the cheese wasn't melted, but in strips!?! The flavor was completely off and the texture was weird. Super greasy, I had two bites and had to stop. My husbands fries looked like they had been sitting out all day. I hope this was just a fluke!

** It was last night around 8pm

BEWARE!

I went there Friday afternoon for a business meeting. Beers were $6 and we got the chicken skewers. It was a tiny breast piece of chicken wrapped around the stick then totally dried out. So gross. The sauce was disgusting. We got the "JoJo" fries. Mediocre, cold when we got them. Our food took forever and was cold when we got it. The place was completely empty! 

Worst part was I checked my bank statement yesterday and they waitress tacked on a $50 tip! She didn't even deserve the tip I gave her, let alone $50 for bringing out 4 beers and some crappy food. 

I drove to the restaraunt to get it taken care of, and there "was no manager there". How do you not have a manager on duty?! I gave them my number and I was nicely called back 24 hours later and told that I was refunded the $50. No offer to discount my check or real apology. Just excuses! This place is a fraud and I will NEVER go back. 

Disgusted!
Herb is the fucking coolest, woo!!! Get good drinks and good service here for sure my fine people!

Super fun menu full of great British treats for my houseguests!  The Brits loved it so much we had to go back a second time during their visit.  Too many choices!  Super service from a friendly waitstaff and excellent prices for huge portions.  My friend said the fish and chips was the best she'd had since a trip to England.  The philly cheesesteak sandwich was a hit with the men!  Fun sports bar with good food...it works!
Great craft beer on tap. Fair price. Nice casual atmosphere. I like the vibe here. Attentive service. They have trivia nights on Tuesday/Wednesday.  I have yet to try the food tho.

This is a great place with good comfort food. The service is decent, but here's the warning ... if you pay with a credit card, they will charge you a fee and not tell you. I questioned why the bill went up 10% after she returned with my credit card and she explained that they charge a fee if a credit card is used. So pay in cash or be prepared to get ripped off. NOTE : 10% is above what Visa charges.

The waiter was extremely rude. When someone at our table ordered a chicken tiki masala and a soup the waiter rudely said "woah that's way too much food!" I've never heard of a waiter complain about someone ordering too much food. I can't understand why as a waiter you wouldn't want the bill to be higher, seeing as that usually means more tip money. There were about 80 people eating and drinking in the place and there was only one server and two bar tenders (I know because one of the comedians on stage mentioned them by name). Yes there was an amateur comedy show going on which I didn't mind. The food was mediocre at best. Also the Chicken tikki masala dish my friend ordered didn't have any chicken in it, when we mentioned it to the rude waiter he simply said "it's shredded into the sauce". The beer was good and the actual place is nice and spacious but they need to have more staff and a manager on sight. Terrible service, mediocre food probably won't be back unless it's to drink at the actual bar and not to eat.

The food here was AMAZING!! The servers were great and I love the open concept layout. They have a blueberry beer that is to die for! I would recommended for a Sunday Funday of a Tuesday after work. Bottom line...YES!

My Friend and I were coming back from a tennis match on the Henderson side of town and we saw Shakespeares's Grille and decided to try it.  We were greeted immediately right when we walked in the door by the GM Joey he was super friendly and made some suggestions on what to order for lunch,  My friend had the recommended Ruben and I had the Chicken Teriakai bowl  We decided to sit at the bar and play some video poker while we waited for our food to come. Our bartender was very friendly and welcoming and our food came very quickly and it was fantastic!  My friend is pretty picky and she said that was the best Rueben she's had in a very long time,  Wasn't fatty and the sauerkraut was very tasty that came with it.  Even her fries were great that I had to try.. My Chicken Teriyaki bowl was exactly what I wanted, I got the Teriakai sauce on the side so I could control how much I wanted to put on.  While we were eating I got 4 of kind and got to spin for an extra bonus of 25.00.  Cashed out and got on our way home but had a great experience at Shakespeare's...Would highly recommended it and I will definitely be back especially to try the fish & chips!
Side note ~ There is no smoking inside and that was a plus for us not to smell smoke when we walked in..

Love this place! Cozy neighborhood bar. Food is amaze balls, fish and chips will rock your world, so will the BBQ Burger and pretzel sticks with beer cheese! Bartenders a super cool too, and pour heavy!

I had been wanting to try this place for quite awhile and I have to say I'm sadly disappointed. We ordered ToGo and everything was off... The Fried Pickles and Sausage Rolls were incredibly soggy from all the grease. Ordered the Pub Mac and Cheese- yet it didn't have the bacon or jalapeños. It was just noodles with not even melted cheese! Maybe the food is better when ate at the actual restaurant... Or maybe we should just stick to the drinks next time!
Love the Shepherd's Pie and Mac & Cheese.  There is something funky with their AC in the summer.  Maybe a Swamp Cooler?  Dunno but food is good.

Came here for Sunday night football and found out that they are a Steelers bar!   Bartenders Lucia and Jamie are super attentive and knowledgeable about their extensive beer selection.  I had a great time!

I have no problems with the food or wait staff, but as a regular pub quiz player on Wednesdays, I am disappointed in the changes to the pub quiz format, and that after a few weeks and vocal complaints from many participants, that it has not gone back to the original format. I don't think I can continue to support a business that doesn't meet the needs of its regular customers.

Went in the other night.  First off the server was great.  Kudos to him but....we had a coupon for two for one entree.  He cheerfully accepted.  I ordered Philly cheesesteak.  On the menu it says it comes with dipping sauce.  Au jus like a french dip. I ordered it because of this being offered. When it arrived it didn't have the sauce.  I asked the guy who brought my food (diff guy) and he brought me sauce in such a small cup that there is no way I could ever get the sandwich or any part of it in there. So the server brought me a bigger bowl (not more sauce btw). So now I have this huge bowl with almost no sauce.  About 7/8 the way through my sandwich I ran out of sauce and asked for more.  At that point he brought about a quart of it out...totally useless at this point because I was almost done.  On a separate note the meal came with a choice of side...in which I picked chicken noodle soup.  Now this was weird.  It was like they were at the bottom of the soup for the night....I got some broth with some spaghetti noodles on top and some diced chicken that had not even been in the soup yet.  The chicken was just sitting on top.  Strangest thing I've ever seen. Would've rather had the fries.  Chicken was terribly dry as well. On to my dining companion.  She ordered the burger.  He asked how she wanted it...she said med rare.  She cut it open in front on him and he agreed it wasn't anywhere near med rare...it was charred...so back to the kitchen.  The next one that came out wasn't close either.  She had one bite....ate the fries and called it good.  She went home hungry.  We also had to ask for napkins and flatware also....even after the food arrived.  They never noticed we didn't have any.  I ordered two drinks.  The server bought one of them for our inconvenience because he knew what happened but the burger was on the coupon so we were out $40 and the wife didn't eat.  Not a good night.  We live about 20 ft away and will not be back.  Too bad.  It sounds like this place has potential.
Luv this place! Great food, great drinks, friendly bar tenders and very clean!!!! Tell your friends if they want to enjoy some great times and friendly atmosphere to come here!!!

Cool little pub in near Silverado Ranch area. 
The staff here is awesome! They are friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. 
The theme nights are a blast. It can get a bit crowded during the theme nights so be prepared to either sit on the comfy sofas or wait for a table. Just wish we would have showed up earlier for the trivia games. Next time we'll get there early! 
They have a huge beer list with quite a few on tap. Looking for a good Irish whiskey or Scotch? This is the place to go. 
I rarely buy bar t-shirts but had to get myself one from here. This place is wonderful!

We must have gone on a bad night. Service was terrible, it took forever to get our server to take our order, provide refills,provide to go boxes and to provide our bill. However I find it interesting that after the bill was dropped off, and we paid that the waiter picked up the bill with our money very quickly.

Food was fine. If it wasn't for the bad service we would return.. But don't think we will return anytime soon.
Great service! Great food! Great beer! Plus its smoke free so you don't leave smelling like an ash tray! Definitely a new "after work" favorite place! :)
Excellent fresh fish, chips ok Poutine is Huge!!  Very good.  Husband says Guinness at the perfect temp.  We will be back  service was excellent

I cannot say enough about this bar.  The bartenders are friendly, fast, and make amazing drinks. The atmosphere is always exciting but still quiet and intimate enough to have a conversation.  Trivia night is one of the absolute best anywhere, and they frequently play rugby on tv.  Anyplace that is advanced enough to play rugby is a sure fire hit in my book!

Awesome food! The service was great! I love all the stuff there. Also love the golden tee golf (; They have movie nights and comedy nights too. Very cool and positive environment that I usually don't get at most pubs and bar/grills.

I read that you serve yourself up your own Guinness and thought I would check it out.    

SG&P is much larger then it appears from the outside and on a Monday there was but a few people. 

For some reason I was expecting more to having access to your own tap of Guinness when I discovered that there was only one table that provided this convenance.  After ponying up to the table the experience fizzled out much like the foam did from the tap.  Alas, the self dispensing Guinness table would not work.  Not to be detoured from at least having a couple of drinks we just ordered from the bartender.

Since it was lunch time I ordered up some fish and chips to compliment atmosphere and the beer.  They were OK and so was the overall experience.

Just left there.  Never been moved to write a review on anything.  Stopped by to play a little keno..I'm generally a $100-$300 depending on how it's going.  People sitting in front of all 15 machines and not a soul playing....you would think the bartender knows for her to make $$ she needs people playing...ran over to winchells and hit a five spot right away..tipped the bartender $20 and I'm out..I'm sure the regulars taking up all the machines took care of the gal at Shakespeare's...c ya

Seriously great place.  We come to trivia every Wednesday and have a blast, food and drinks as well as service are all awesome. Wish it was closer to my house and I'd be there more often. The fish & chips are best I've had in town by far.

Stopped in for a recent happy hour. They don't really have any great happy hour drink specials. Well drinks are BOGO @ $10 so they were still $5 each during happy hour? What kind of happy is that? #ShakespearesFail. Service was ok. Server kept trying to be funny & it just got annoying after awhile. Ordered up the fish tacos (2 for $5) on the happy hour menu. Meh. Taco shell was so rubbery it was hard to get a decent bite when the taco wasn't actually falling apart in your hands. Not sure what they put on it to make it so wet but when I finally got to the 2nd taco the shell itself busted when I picked it up so I opted to just eat the food inside the taco shell rather than the whole taco. Didn't have much flavor. I won't be going back again. A shame too since it's a local bar to my area.
Super chill bar with great service and lots of craft beers on tap and in the bottle. Would definitely recommend coming on Sundays at 6 for their music bingo!

Heads up: HH is only Mon-Fri, even though their website advertises it as daily. Staff is aware of this, yet no one has bothered to update the site in (their estimate) 2 years?!

The Yelp Book Club timed our visit for HH, so being rudely informed that it didn't exist wasn't the best start to our visit. Our server came by twice in 45 minutes and drinks took 20 minutes to come out. We had to go to the bar to place an order- and we were the only table. With such aggressively unhelpful service, the food did not make up for our experience.

POUTINE: This spot goes the extra mile to bread and fry the cheese curds. So the dish is basically cheese fries with cheese sticks, with some underwhelming Guiness gravy. Fries were unseasoned, gravy was lackluster, dish went unfinished split among three people.
SOUP OF THE DAY: $5 for their daily bowl, which was chicken curry. It was mostly rice and had no spice, as though this were Campbell's interpretation of a curry. Not thrilled.
SCOTCH EGG: Sausage was eerily reminiscent of a breakfast sausage, but the mustard aioli on the plate kicked things up a level. This is sided with a heap of spring greens they call a salad, but nothing else. Odd.
STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING: Spiced and sauced bundt cake, with a bit of whipped cream. This version does not come close to comparing to any others in town. Go elsewhere for your fix. Another unfinished dish for us.

Dismal food and shitty service make for a large empty bar in the middle of the weekend, despite large screens showing multiple sports games. I wouldn't recommend this spot and I won't be back. Crown & Anchor has friendly service, a similar menu, and better quality.

Very rarely do I like places this much the first time.  It has a great atmosphere, and made me feel welcome. 
 I will definitely be there on in quiz nights. And the food is worth it by itself.

Shakespeare's Grille & Pub was in my bookmarks for quite some time. Due to increasingly negative reviews it started to fall far down the priority list. Friday night, one of my best friends and I decided to do light bar hopping in Anthem and Shakespeare's was brought up. The space inside was quite large. I was expecting a dark and dingy dive bar, but it was actually decently lighted, clean, and very spacious. After chatting with the bartender, who was very friendly and accommodating, we found out that this place is now under new ownership. Then we got to chat with the new owner. He was extremely friendly and accommodating as well. He expressed great interest in customer feedback, yelp, and ways to appease his customers in general. He told us they are simplifying and redesigning the menu, and although we did not order any food, I am sure I will be back to sample some of the fare they have to offer. 

The owner also has fun events planned for each day of the week such as trivia night, karaoke night, and even bringing in live bands. That sounds petty awesome for a little neighborhood bar!  They also have the TouchMusic jukebox of which I am the master with my little app. Another bonus! We had a slew of drinks for $20, so this is definitley not a "strip" priced bar which is a great thing. Give it a shot! I am thinking of organizing a UYE here sometime down the line.

The owner/manager set his staff up for failure today. One bartender, out of 4 tap beers, and a full house for Soccer Championship game. So bad that a friend/customer is helping with drink orders.
250 beers are excellent when you don't have to wait 30 mins to order one.
Had a great time there at the comedy show the service was fantastic, the food mouth watering and the place was clean and very exciting.also a plus the food was affordable....
Love this spot ! It's extremely "chill". Love the patio area outside to hang with your friends, beer in hand, smoking a cig. & their draft selection is the sh*t !!! :) Service is always legit !!

Not your typical gaming bar, although the ambiance might suggest this.  When you look a little past the 24 hr. Gaming you'll see an amazing beer list, rivaling many of the tap houses around town. There beer program is on point with things like evil twin Molotov cocktail on tap, and Dogfish Head 120 for sale. The food is typical bar food pumped up a bit. Offerings like poutine fries, and street tacos, and just about anything you could think of. The service is outstanding. The bartender, Kelly, is friendly knowledgeable and fast. The other patrons of this bar are nice and welcoming, make you feel like you're right at home.

I like hanging out here.  Nice to sit on the patio and grab a cold beer on a warm evening. They have an amazing selection of bottled and beers on tap.  There are different events here depending on the night.  Trivia night, this place gets pretty packed.  The service needs improvements tho.  I have yet to try the food.

Service was Fantastic!

It was clean, quiet (for a Saturday) and they have free darts and $1 Pool which we played.   Small menu to choose from but we were dicing and didnt get any choices anyways!

Dice made me get a burger with blue cheese and egg, It was OK--I kind of found the meat chewy, maybe it was the fattiest meat, Just not what I am used to eating but my ex also ordered a burger and didnt care for it, I thought, well maybe because I am mostly Vegan, I just dont like meat anymore but that was not the case!

Friend ordered the teriyaki bowl and loved it.   The chili was ok but NOT spicy at all.   

Probably wouldnt return...

I love this place, although recently changed owners, we haven't seen a change/drop in quality. The staff is always on it and they have lots of fun things like trivia nights. (Beware the smatypants table at trivia, the same table always crushes it- it's not me). The food is great and they have a fantastic beer selection. Game days rock here too.

Service was good  but a little slow.... but not saying it as a bad thing...poor waitress was all by herself to take care of the entire floor! Food was pretty good. And beers were....interesting to say the least but overall it was a good experience!

The food was amazing it was just Fish & Chips. But I'm a Native Vegan and for a Bar and Grill type Pub with a very cool atmosphere. I recommend this location for a great experience. Oh and Shelly the Bartender/Waitress/Everything was Amazing as well and the place was about half packed. Cuddos to Shelly Job Well Done!!!!

Love the atmosphere! It's nice and cozy with tables and sofas. Plenty of screens to watch any sports games. If you want a more chill experience, you can sit outside. There was karaoke tonight which was fun! They have it every Friday and live music Saturdays.

Oh. My. Gosh! The food! Blows Gordon Ramsay's pub and grille out of the water! My husband had the fish and chips which were decadent and cooked to perfection! Actual British chips unlike Gordon's shoestring fries and for half the price. I had the lamb sliders served with a brown gravy which was truly DIVINE! I could just eat a bowl of gravy and be a super happy camper!

We will most definitely be back with friends and family!
Great pub right down the road. They have a clean friendly enviroment with great food and service. Great place to watch any soccer match or other sporting events.

Surprisingly nice atmosphere for a bar in a strip mall.  Large open spaces, NO SMOKING, lots of great beers on tap.  

There is a large projector screen and several TVs scattered around the bar,  this would be a great place to watch a game.

Pool tables, Golden Tee and a juke box!

Ordered a blt sandwich on Uber eats not realizing I had accidentally put the wrong delivery address, I called Uber eats right away to see about canceling the order, they called the restaurant and Shakespeare's said they would not cancel it because they had already started making it, I couldn't have it delivered to where it was going to because I am on the complete opposite side of town, so now I am still charged $21 and have no blt sandwich.  I understand that it was my mistake but what would happen if someone called in an order directly from you guys and they just never picked it up, they wouldn't be charged for it.  Customer service should always come first and I hope that $21 was worth losing a loyal customer for life who will never spend another dollar with you again.

I've been coming to Shakespeare's for the last several months solely for their Wednesday night live trivia contests; I live too far to frequent it otherwise. The wait staff have always been prompt and courteous, so no complaints there. My current issue, which I took up directly with the owner, is a format change in their contests, wherein they will no longer have a moderator reading a couple of the rounds' questions. It feels less participatory, and as a result, less fun, in a team context, to remove that element of interplay.

In defending his "tweaking" of the format, he seemed to be significantly overstating the frequency and repetition of questions that required clarification, and that, he claimed, was disturbing some of the bar-top poker machine players. Given that they probably draw upwards of 80-100 people every Wednesday for these contests, I think a few questions repeated over the PA for clarification are a small price to pay, when one considers the risk of losing the many players who like the new format less or not-at-all.

Nice beer selection for a neighborhood joint, good food (except the scotch egg, everything else has been solid), good atmosphere to hang out with friends.  The two sort of weak points are the design and service.  Something about the layout causes smells to waft from the kitchen into the bar area, which is fine when it's food, not so much when it's cleaning solutions.  

The other iffy is the service from male wait staff, the bartenders and female wait staff are fine.  They go a long time between visits, which is fine when you've got time, but annoying when it takes twenty minutes to place your food order if you made the mistake of knowing what you wanted to drink.  The general attitude from male wait staff is that they'd rather be elsewhere, although a couple are sufficiently knowledgeable about beer and not listed bottles to make up for the lackluster approach to the rest of their job.

Just ordered from them on Uber eats. We got chicken wings, grilled cheese and a quesadilla. All were terrible. We just had to throw it all away.  The wings were all fat, the grilled cheese was like two pieces of cardboard with rubber in the middle and the steak in the quesadilla was just plain gross.  I was hoping this place would be great but sad to say it was nothing close.

Good food, great beer. 

Many great beers on tap and in the bottle. They have a wide selection of food. The fish and chips were ok, must have had a bad batch, everyone else was raving, ours was just ok.
Really a mostly comic, somewhat dramatic but never tragic experience! Nina was great fun and made my solo trip full of bonhomie!

Went for trivia night and was severely disappointed. The food was pretty terrible- my scotch egg was over fried, the sticky toffee pudding was hard as a rock atrocious, the cheesecake was grainy, and, with the bar focused on beer, the drinks were so-so.  The kitchen definitely failed on getting orders out on time and well cooked. 
They might have been overwhelmed by the trivia night crowd, but the service was abysmally slow. It took well over 25 minutes to get an appetizer and 2 of the other things we ordered never even showed up (we were a table of 5, nothing crazy). The server was kind and never showed us any frustration, but she just couldn't get the job done. 
The beer selection is massive so I suppose you could make a night of it with the entertainment- they do have a lot going on, just eat somewhere else first and order your drinks 2 at a time.

Jamie is a great bartender and also a great food served as well. She always tells us what is good on the menu and she always suggests good drinks from the bar. She takes the time to actually listen to her customers. Jamie is the only reason that we come into Shakespeare's.

Funny start to my first time here.

We just walked in the door to see a waiter accidently dump a glass of water down someone's back at a large table. Looked like an entire family was being served and they had their hands full. So, given the place was nearly empty just after 5pm on the weekend I wondered what was going to happen next...

Service was fairly prompt as other patrons filtered in with some choosing general seating with others going to the bar. Had a wonderful fish & chips dinner. small crowd so service was, as expected, on par with expectations. Cod was very good and large...fries were tasty with generous helping and the Red Hen [something] craft was unique given the jalapeno bite at the end of each sip. Apparently it was brewed in Henderson(?)

Staff remained on top of things as well as being polite so good tip was the reward. Plenty of big screens...nice "old world" style decor with a mix of modern flair.

Parking was crowded as they share spots with many other establishments in a typical collage mixed strip mall set up.

Will be back to try a new dish (corned beef or other) for sure. Maybe we'll get to see if they can maintain service and food quality while juggling a larger crowd. I've read some of the 1 and 2 star ratings. Wow. With that in mind I'll update after a second visit.

Edit: Took home leftover cod and fries for part of next nights dinner - very yummy after removing from toaster oven.
We go on Wednesday when thay have the trivia game..Food is not bad..Fun place and very crowded on Wednesday

I've been here once so far, but I am excited to try it again. Seems like a great strip mall find.

My friend arrived first, and after eating their wings and burger, called me with the insistent demand that I must come check this place out. He assured me that the wings were fantastic, especially for 6 wings being less than $6. However, as I didn't even see, let alone taste, the wings or burger, I can't really comment. But suffice it to say that my friend swears they were delicious.

After checking-in on Foursquare and getting a "special offer" for 20% off an appetizer, I decided to order their mac 'n' cheese. It arrived in what is typically a french onion soup bowl. All crispy cheese goodness on top and ooey, gooey, swimming in tons of cheese on the inside. I have no clue what cheeses were used (and the menu offers no description), but it was excellent. At first glance, it seemed like a small serving, but after digging in, it became clear that there was no way I was going to finish it - very filling. Based on the mac 'n' cheese (and my friend's insistence on the excellent wings), I will definitely be back to try out some other menu items.

And they have a better than average selection of beer. Bartenders were nice, if a little inattentive. Good space and set-up. All in all, it is winning so far over the other bars in my immediate area. Here's hoping the return visit holds up.

Went there for dinner last week and was pleasantly surprised.  When we walked in we were a little concerned as the place seemed quite empty, it was around 7:00pm on a Sunday night.  We decided to sit at the bar have dinner maybe play a little poker/blackjack.  We looked over the menu, which was a bit eclectic, but all sounded appetizing.  A local bar fly, seemed to have the Norm at Cheers thing going on, suggested we try the fish and chips--so we did and it was deliciously!  We also had a potato jalapeno soup quite tasty!  Mike was our waiter/bartender very nice and quite attentive.  Would definitely return..

Terrible food. The only thing that wasn't microwaved was my wife's burger. Our server was also not great,Spanish guy,very cocky and was slower than frozen molasses. We were there during a local brew fest,the beer was far from good which would explain why nobody was there. I will not make a future return visit.
Jorge was the best server yet!!! He was very attentive and brought my cocktails right away. I would return with Jorge as my server!

Four people ordering breakfast.
First of all...our server, Shelly, was very nice.  We understand a server can only deliver food after it is prepared.  So it would not be fair to say poor service.  We were the only ordering customers.  Our food took a long time to be prepared.  My biscuits and gravy were Luke warm and TASTELESS.  The other ordinary bacon, eggs and undertoasted, unbuttered sourdough bread was at least edible.
 I actually do not understand this restaurant could serve anything worth eating.
Don't bother ....to many great restaurant

My girlfriend and I literally just walked out of this establishment i sheer disappointment. 

My girlfriend is from england and was extremely excited to have a full english breakfast. We walked up to the bar and this young blonde woman approached us and asked "what can i get you to drink". We ordered two waters and two full english breakfasts "in a thick english accent".

We then play two games of pool before being served two plates of an american breakfast. 

I return to the bartender with the food (we did not order) & she says oh hahaha im sorry. 

She was dropping glasses behind the bar, seemed overwhelmed, and really inexperienced.

We wont be returning here again!

It's time I reviewed this local bar/pub since I frequent it with my friends every Wednesday night for Trivia Night. The first time my husband and I happened upon it, we walked into a huge Jayhawks party. Turns out it's a KU alumni hub as well. This is a fun place, sports bar and English pub with the best Fish and Chips in town. Come for Trivia on Wednesdays or Karaoke Fridays or any day. But here's the important part... ask for Andre's section. He's your new best friend!
No it was a few weeks ago and it was busy. We will try you out again as we have heard you are a Steelers bar

Its a little drive for us but well worth it! I love the staff here, and the food and drink is just amazing. Its not a fancy place but has excellent pub food! Favorites so far are a steak sandwich, burger, meat pies, and these potato chip dish I can't remember the name of. Some sort of nacho I think. ANYWAY, I highly recommend this place.

I just started going to this pub as I moved here recently. It's about my 3rd or 4th time. There is a day shift bar tender that's really cool in fact, I lost $300 once and she bought me breakfast which made me feel good and I came back. The first time was a night bartender and he was awesome as well. Tonight however, two bartenders were here and one worse than the other. Never once came over and asked me if I wanted a drink until I called one over. I asked for a beer and she rudely said while rolling her eyes "ya what kind" as if totally impatient. Most bar tenders smile and greet you, especially if you've never met them. I had a few $100 bills on the table to play and one would think that commands at least a greet or some sort of professional hello. When my food came (great food btw) I had fries and she didn't even offer me ketchup or a napkin and certainly never another beer. It was a horrible experience and all they did was gossip in the corner together. I will never come here on a Friday night again. They are a poor reflection of your business.
Great local spot with over 100 craft beers.  Need I say more?  Looking forward to coming here again
Trivia here on Wednesdays is really fun.  Some of my friends complain it is hard to hear, but I think they just don't really pay attention.  The food and service are very good.

A Guinness and Harp tap at your own table??  SNAP!  Too bad there's only one table like that, but the cost would be prohibitive to do them all.  This place isn't much for atmosphere and on Wednesday night we always get the slowest server ever.  However, it's a lovely, quiet place for lunch, they have an amazing selection of beers on tap, video poker if you want it and it's a FUN place to go.  For some reason it always seems just a bit too warm inside, even in the winter.  Weird.  But I would go.  Get the curry sauce to dip your fries in.  The sausage rolls are DIVINE!

Yummy food in this pub and great tasting beer. A must swing in and enjoy the environment and staff. We showed up on a Wednesday evening and they had some kind of trivia night which was a lot of fun just too be around. They had a few pool tables as well. Great place!

Love the food. Potato wedges come in a very large portion for $4. Add some fish tacos from the happy hour menu (2 for $5)and you are set. This is the same fish as the fish and chips, great crispy battered pieces.

The service can be a bit slow but the folks always seem friendly, even with nondrinkers in the party. Lots of room and it is always nice to be able to choose where you want to sit. Lots of TVs around for the sports minded.
So good. Just so good. Fish and chips are to die for. Perfectly battered. Homemade tartar sauce and coleslaw. Amazing potato wedges. I love Shakespeare's!!!

thanks to dana s for the uye trivia. they had kilkenny so i was happy. ordered the shepards pie. they turned the top of the gravy into a zen garden with cool designs. it had a good salt level. some places go way overboard on the salt. our waiter was a good character and had no problem doing separate checks! 

the quiz portion was fun! although i think our large group was excited and yelling out answers. i was guilty of this as well. after the quiz ended it got really quiet. a little too quiet.

[The three Turtles infiltrate The Shredder's junkyard.]
Donatello: The perimeter's quiet.
Leonardo: Yeah, a little too quiet.
Michelangelo: Come on.
[The Turtles sneak forward; Donatello takes out two sentries solo]
Donatello: Well, that was easy.
Leonardo: Yeah, a little too easy.
[They see Raphael tied to a post]
Donatello: Look, it's Raph!
Michelangelo: Yeah, a little too Raph.

when i first used the bathroom i kept trying to lift the handle to wash my hands at the sink, but realized after like 2 attempts that it was an automatic faucet that looked like a handle. tricky... very tricky...

Stopped into this place after seeing it on Groupon (or living social) several times and never really paying attention to where it was. Found the atmosphere to be delightful cozy, service, impeccable, and the menu affordable, and delicious. We weren't here to drink, but they do have an extensive beer menu, which I took advantage of. I love trying different beers, especially if the only way I can try them outside of a bar is in a 6 pack of bottles for 30 bucks. No thanks! Anyway we got a hodge podge of food. Buffalo Mac and Cheese, poutine with Guinness and onion gravy, and a Rueben sandwich. Buff was AWESOME. I love mac and cheese and this was fantastic. Poutine was good, not as magical as I wanted, because the idea of Guinness gravy sounded amazing. Oh well, still very good. The Rueben was ok, but I don't like Rueben Sandwiches, so that's an unfair judgement. It was pretty neutral in flavor so I could eat it. (Not a fan of corned beef) The price was very inexpensive for what we got and as I said the sevice was top notch. I don't know what this place is like usually, but it seemed fairly low key and quiet, which totally suits us. We will be back.

Came here a couple weeks ago because my friend was having an event there. I have to say it was a little difficult to find. I guess I just assumed it was a stand alone building but was surprised to find it in group of other buildings. Tons of beer on tap which is a huge plus! I tried a few different ones but needless to say I can't remember which ones! I didn't try any of the food but I heard it was ok. They also have a fire pit out front which was cool to sit around towards the end of the night.

We used Yelp to find this place, which was close to where we wanted to go for the evening.  We were heading over to Green Valley Resort, and we stopped here at about 8pm on Saturday, August 20th. 

It was just two of us, and we found a table right in front of a big screen that was playing NFL Preseason football.  The restaurant/bar itself was actually a great place, well laid out with lots to see and do.   

Our server, which referred to himself as the beer connoisseur was very friendly, nice and helpful.  Kudos to him!

However, sorry to say, the food left a lot to be desired.  We ordered the English Nachos and the Sampler Basket and we shared both.  On the Sampler Basket, the chicken tenders and poppers were way overcooked -- in fact the poppers were actually blackened/burnt.  The wings and onion rings were pretty good.  The menu says it comes with three sauces; however, ours only came with Ranch.

The nachos were plentiful; however, the taste was pretty bland and nothing exciting.

Could I have mentioned something while I was seated and eating -- sure I could have.  However, I am not the type of person that likes complaining about my food while in a restaurant.   

So, again, on the positive side, the portions were plentiful and our server was nice.  I would try this place again in the future (maybe in a couple of years) to see if the food has improved to my tastes.

What a fun place.  Andre our waiter was fantastic.  The food was great and the atmosphere even better.  Brought our dog and he was treated like a king!  Sat on the patio and enjoyed a beautiful night.

Would definitely give this spot a five star but service really sucked once the regulars came in. We had excellent service at the beginning but once the bartenders friends showed up we were ignored. As I write this the bartender has passed my empty glass 4 times to speak to her friends. And yeah she's looked our way. Great beer selection. My brother said the food was good. I would have ordered if we weren't being passed up. Cheers
Poutine with cheese curds yum! Mashed potatoes perfect. Cabbage soup delicious but super small portion for $5 :( leaving me disappointed. Fish tacos superb!

Recap & review, to me it was just a normal pub "ordinary". The food was okay, nothing to really get excited about. I observed that they were short staffed, Jorge our server/waiter/busser/pre-cook and who knows what else? Had made a huge difference. He was on it! There was another big group including ours and he managed to take care of all of us. Kudos to Jorge! i had stumbled my way back into the kitchen when i noticed him prepping food, of course i had to make things more difficult by ordering something that wasn't on the menu. He kindly obliged. Whoa! this guy has heart. 
What made this pub nice was the patrons, the patrons made everything come alive. good food, good drink, good people and that hilarious card game. Passer byes stopped to ask what group we were in and what the heck we were doing. I guess we get a little silly and we do laugh a lot, literally "laughing out loud". i do apologize if i had offended anyone, i do get a little out of hand, i'm really not that guy. Anyhow, we had a good time and i even got a Shakespeare's T-shirt (i like collecting stuff). Upon leaving i shook Jorge's hand and thanked him for his service, i left him a generous tip. 
My suggestion, though it's not the greatest pub, it is a pub and if you want a good experience bring lots of people and that funny card game. I'm still laughing at the answers. (oh yeah, the juke box was annoying)

Cheers!

Enjoyed a nice Saturday dinner with wife here. Wasn't greeted by anyone when we first came in, but it is a pub primarily.  Our server came by and was very attentive.  We tried the fried pickles, which were cut like french fries, a large portion, and very good. Wife ordered the shepherd's pie. She liked it and ate all of it. I thought it could have been a larger portion actually,  as it was seved in thin dish, but  it needed to be a deeper dish. I ordered the fish fry, which was a huge portion of two large fillets on a mound of fries and small side of slaw. This could easily serve two, or inquire about a half portion. It tasted very good. We had a few beers, in the $7 range. Atmosphere was good. Clean, no  smoke, a couple dart boards, one pool table,  large interior on the dark side. My wife and I were very pleased overall and definitely would go again.

Super fun pub to go to!!!! Good food and great variety of beer!!! Love going to the pub music bingo on sundays!!!! The lady who runs it is super fun nice and helpful!!!!! We had a blast and came back the next week!!!!!!!

Best Fish n Chips in town! Cozy laid back unpretentious atmosphere. Feels like the ones I used to go to back in Boston. Poutine is also great. Prices are reasonable with great lunch specials and a lot of food for the money. So much better than the overpriced pseudo gastro pubs on the strip. This place is also great for kids. Pool table and darts to keep them happy and not a bunch of obnoxious drunk people hanging around.

Super fun English pub over on Eastern, which gets PACKED on Tuesday and Wednesday for Trivia nights. Be sure to get there early to get a table or else you'll have to fight for a spot at the bar. Large food menu with yummy British fare e.g. chips and curry, fish and chips, shepherds pie, etc...all reasonably priced and large portions, not greasy. 

HUGE beer menu! It features many of the local breweries such as Tenaya, Banger, and Bad Beat, and has everything from Sculpin, to Delirium, to Polygamy Porter.

The best thing here is Andre. He is the reason we come here. He is by far one of the best servers I have ever come across. The 1 star is for the new karaoke host here. They are by far the worst I have seen. I have been to many across the country and they are the worst. There are 4 of them, they make sure all of the friends are at the top of the rotation. If they don't know you, you won't have a prayer of singing for at least 2 hours or more.

This pub sells my favorite type of food to eat while drunk, which includes: sloppy poutine, nachos, burgers, and wings. In addition, it's always got a great selection of local beers. We went here lay night, Thursday night and partook in local news night which was 4 dollar drafts. We had 4 milk shake style beers that captured my heart. After getting nice and toasty, our waiter was supportive of us relocating to a pool table where we continued to try a few new beers. That was my kind of night.

Anyways, here's the gist of it. Shakespeare's has a rotating selection of beers so I am always able to try something new. The food is great for a pub restaurant, but I come for the beer. Service is usually good, and there is something different each day. Wednesday's I think they have trivia and Fridays they do karaoke. There's always enough parking and a chill crowd. When I want to drink socially, this is my go to place.
Excellent food and service.  Can't wait to go back!  We will definitely try sitting outside.  I love that they have a dog friendly patio.

Was visiting Vegas and joined my friend for her son's 21st birthday at Shakespeare's.  What a great place and atmosphere.  Incredible service, can't remember our servers name but he was exceptional, drinks were good and the food was delish!  Their breaded chicken strips, sliders and fries were out of this world.  Wish I could have eaten more, but I was stuffed.  Will visit again when in town.

I really want to like this place but the service makes it so hard. Bartenders seem to only want to talk to regulars or friends than serve anyone else. 6 people sitting at the bar and it takes a long time to get any attention to get a drink. She said she was a little backed up yet always had time to chat with her friends. Third time I have been here, shame on me for giving it three times before throwing in the towel. If the bartenders start paying attention to non friends I might be back, but doubtful. Such a shame, great beer selection, it just so hard to actually get one.

Went for my first time this weekend and the bartender was extremly friendly and nice. She was the only one working and on top of it. My drink was always filled and she was very easy to talk to. I will be going back!

The food was very good for bar food. We had steak & mushroom pie & chicken tikka masala.  Both meals were very good.  Our bartender,Lucia, was extremely personal & helpful. We will definitely be back.

I made a visit to this bar late last night to see some amazing comedians for open mic night. I was getting a little hungry waiting for the show to start. I decided to look at a menu while I waited. The waitress was very concerned about what I wanted to order which made me very pleased with this experience. Usually, the waitress will walk away to give me a second and think. Not today my friends! She held my hand and told me everything was going to be ok! Also, she told me that my heart was made of gold. I was convinced I was going to marry this waitress!


I ended up ordering the Beer Battered Chicken Fingers w/ fries. 

Let me tell you that at first I was worried. 
$9 for some chicken fingers? 
Is McDonalds open?!

I followed through to eat this amazing creation. Overall, the chicken fingers are definitely in their own category. I forgot to mention that I am a chicken finger ambassador! 

The only thing I didn't like about the experience was the amount of ranch I received. I love ranch with my chicken fingers. That's just how I roll!

This place is fantastic, the food is made with love for sure. Everything we have ordered recently is delicious. I have only had it delivered. The food is always hot, correct is delivered quickly within 30. Min. The Rachel is my new favorite sandwich ever. Good job guys.
corned beef sandwich is good.  beers are good and the price is well.  Check in for a discount.

I was in there on a Friday night...great time. Very fun atmosphere. Bartender working was Lucia...she was awesome! Very attentive...great personality...and answered all our questions about beers and promotions. I even won on the machines while I was there. Big thank you to Lucia! I will be back.

Loved the atmosphere. The waitress was nice, but a little scatterbrained -- my friend and I ordered Crabbie's Ginger Beer (They have Crabbie's!), but she brought us Newcastle Cabbie Ale because she didn't realize there were two similar sounding beers on the menu. But she took care of it right away. They were also out of the whiskey (McAllen) and beer (Dogfish Head 90) that the guys ordered, which was disappointing for them. On the plus side, they've got darts and pool. Crabbie's, darts, and pool -- pretty much all I need in a neighborhood bar.

Wow! Justin and Cory have really made Shakespeare's an awesome place to hang out and get some good food. This has become one of my favorite hangouts because it's such a comfortable environment and the bartenders and wait staff are amazing. It's like the "Cheers" of Henderson for us, because "everybody knows your name." Shannon, Jeff, Jorge, Lucia are always treating us special. We love to go for Wednesday pub quiz/trivia and often on Fridays (the karaoke night gets some awesome singers).

There are so many pubs in Vegas, it's hard to choose a favorite. But, if I lived closer I could see how this place could become a favorite.

There's plenty of parking and when we were there for a late lunch there was plenty of seating. Plus a real bonus is that it's all non-smoking except on the patio. 

Had super friendly service from Shelly.  She did a great job suggesting a brew (Victory at Sea Coconut - Ballast Point Brewing), it was a super good Porter with just the right amount of chocolate, vanilla and coffee flavoring with a strong but very tasty coconut flavor. Unusual, but easy, pleasant and very good.

For food we had the Poutine, Fish & Chips and a Burger. Everything was very good and very favorable. 

Again, a place that's easy to like and enjoy. Overall, a great experience.

Taming of the brew.

This might become one of my regular haunts, mostly because the drinks are strong and I can crawl home. I decided  to stop here on a random Tuesday night before calling it a night and was greeted by the sounds of "Pub Trivia Night". "Where was Britney Spears born?",  "ummm...the South?" I thought as I bellied up to the bar. 

I dig the decor in this place; old school lanterns, unique European chandeliers hanging from the ceiling, and a giant British Flag above the bar, so Londony! As I looked at the bar menu I noticed that they serve Poutine! The American werewolf in my belly growled as I ordered this insanely rich dish and a fresh adult beverage. If you're not familiar with this traditionally Canadian dish, Poutine is a decadent pile of french fries, cheese curds and gravy, be still my beating heart. No seriously, it could have stopped while I was consuming it. Shakespeare's Pub also has a bevy of beers on tap, but I went with the vodka & soda. I wasn't sure if I could handle a Stout beer along with gravy soaked cheese fries. 

As I waited for my food and drink, I chatted it up with the bartenders and got the 4-1-1 on the trivia nights. Not is only does it get packed in here every Tuesday and Wednesday, but if your team wins you get to sit at what I'm calling the "Champions' Table". It's a table with a beer tap attached, serving of course, Guinness and Harp. I'm not sure if the winners get to choose the beers. As I pondered the idea of adding a toilet to a table that I would never have to leave, my Poutine arrived in all of it's gravy and cheese covered glory. Now a normal or "classic" Poutine would have regular cheese curds. However, in the Shakespeare's Pub version they are breaded and fried. AMAZING! I dived in fork first. 

I consumed about half of this order along with some help from my girlfriend, after which my food coma took over. Love this place, love the people who work here, and love/hate the Poutine. To quote Shakespeare...

"Unquiet meals make ill digestions", True Dat! 

I will definitely be coming back to Shakespeare's Grille and Pub.

Shakespears is hands down the best local gaming bar in the Henderson/Vegas area.  I refuse to play machines anywhere but here.  The machines are looser then any where else I have played and I have had a ton of luck.  I'm hooked on the video poker machines at the bar and I swear I can't lose when playing them. 

The food and drinks are 10/10 and service is always on point.  Friday nights are great for karaoke and Sundays are always fun for music bingo. Overall this is a great place to come and have some drinks with friends but even better for a fun night of gambling

This place is awesome and the service is great...I heard a customer say they were disappointed in the place because the couldn't accomidate a large party during World Cup...lol..You go to an English pub on World Cup with a large party without a reservation....That's smart...but it's the places fault...lol!!! Large Party = Reservation...duh...This place is great..

Enjoyed Sunday Brunch a couple days ago.

Sat outside which was great since the sun was out and the skies were blue... gotta take advantage of the nice weather while it lasts.

It's a small area outside but there was no one there but my group so it worked out good for us.
