The inside is a lot bigger than I thought it would be.  It's nice inside... not too dark and not stuffy.  There are video poker machines at the bar.

Good place to hang out.

And it's good for groups because they were able to do individual checks.

Menu wasn't super extensive but it included some nice options.

The service is OK.... I think it's cuz we sat outside that the servers were a bit less attentive.  Not sure. The gal got my order wrong but I'm not holding that totally against her ...  she probably didn't hear me correctly over everyone's talking.

The food... taste... preparation.... mediocre.  My eggs were a bit cold and dry.  But the potatoes were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

The pancakes on the other hand were Very Good.... 3 big cakes... hot... fluffy... NICE!  And it was served with some really good looking, red and plump strawberries.

Bloody Mary was pretty good.  Better than Republic Kitchen's ... not as good as The Cafe at THEhotel.

I've been coming here for awhile now and can never get enough, absolutely love this place! The service is great, people are friendly, drinks and food are always on point. 

Special mention to Herb, Andre, and Mat!! The owners themselves are awesome as well. 

Friday night is karaoke night, I don't sing but it's so fun to watch!! 

Highly recommend you check this bar out.

Beer selection is ok. Mostly bottle varieties, heavy on the IPAs and stouts. Food was ok. The layout of the furniture leaned more towards bar than grill. Probably go to this place for drinks with friends over dinner. Pool table, darts, and lots of TVs for game watching.

Great service. Same people as used to be at Fado's. So you know the food and staff will be great.
Pity the decor doesn't match the name. It looks like its going to be an English Pub from the name, but is just the old sports bar that closed, with a new name.

They have the best poutine fries I've had outside of canada. With fried cheese curds and onion gravy, it really hits the spot along side a good beer. Their selection of brews is pretty good and is definitely worth exploring. Overall, a nice place to grab a drink and some bites with friends or family.

Great local bar. Great food. Order the patty melt. Great people. Bartenders are amazing and Herp is THE MAN! But don't tell him that lol. They have pool darts and jenga! They have Karaoke on Friday night's which I love! And trivia night on Wednesdays I think. Family friendly bar the only thing is that you can't smoke inside but that's good for you! Definitely recommend. Owner is great as well and visits once in a while! Andre is a really cool dude by the way. And the girls are all amazing especially Sylvia she's very kind.

This place has some awesome pub food! The poutine is awesome and I love shelleys buffalo Mac n cheese. Great happy and great service everytime I've been so far. Wednesday nights are trivia night and my group had SO much fun. I definitely was not made for trivia but it was a great atmosphere and just really great vibes overall. Loved the bartender. They made a great Moscow mule and they have a great beer selection. Definitely a must try if you haven't yet!

This is the best place in Henderson to grab a beer if you're looking for a casual place with good food to watch a game. I'm not local, but Tanner made me feel like I was. Best bartender I've encountered in awhile. The beer selection is great, and the food is good, too. Definitely will be back....tomorrow.

Friday night is a fun night to come here for karaoke. Great, warm atmosphere. Pool table, darts. TVs all around. It's bright enough to see the the karaoke singers so if you're shy, you can't hide.

Food is okay. The poutine is *NOT* traditional poutine. Instead, it's steak-cut fries smothered in brown gravy with melted cheddar cheese and fried mozzarella sticks. Totally not what I expected when I ordered it off the menu. It tasted fine- like hangover food- but it was NOT the poutine I desired.

The scotch eggs were okay. My Englishman hubby felt the crust was too crispy and thick. 

I'd come back here for the beer and the camaraderie.

I've only been here twice but see myself returning a lot. Our bartender, Shelly makes some of the best bloody marys I've had in a long time. The fish and chips was outstanding, best I've had in memory and the hot wings are very good too. There are several items on the menu that I want to try since the fish and the wings were so good. They have big screens on all the wall with sports plus a couple dart boards.
Pub Quizes on Wednesday nights are awesome!  Good fun with good beer!

Dad and I checked this place out last Monday afternoon and were pleasantly surprised!

It was completely dead since it was about noon on a Monday...we were the only occupants of the restaurant aside from a lone barfly and the guy who took our order.

The decor is pretty cool and makes you feel like you're not necessarily eating at a place set in a strip mall of of Eastern Avenue. It's also quite dark, which is a nice atmospheric touch.

I ended up ordering Ian's Savory Meat Pie and Dad had a bacon cheeseburger. Both of them came with delicious potato wedges, and each entree tasted pretty dang good. The filling of the meat pie consisted of seasoned beef, peas and carrots. It definently warmed me up on a cold day.

I only knock this place because it is a little too expensive for the fare offered and because the service is a bit slow, although extremely friendly. They do have a happy hour with discounted appetizers though and a late night menu which appeared to have some good prices as well.

We had dined here before it was Shakespeare's and thought we would check it out again.  It was busy with a 50th birthday party setup as you came in the door.  We found our own table.  Waiter was friendly and got our drink order.  Instead of a McCallem neat as asked it came on the rocks but he was prompt in correcting the situation

My husband ordered the homemade pot pie and I ordered the Rueben with onion rings being told they were homemade too.  

Food was delivered the chicken pot pie was an inch tall and looked a little soggy.  While it tasted ok my husband said it was more like a frittata minus the eggs.  When we asked the waiter how this could be a pot pie my husband explaining he was English he knows what a pot pie should be  

The waiter said he saw the chef make it in the morning.  He did say the chef was Mexican so it was his interpretation of an English pot pie!   That gave us a good laugh. 

The sandwich was good but the onion rings were out of a bag.

Great English bar! I've been here many times but now it's under new management and it is even better. Go see Lucia and Andre,
 (You couldn't get better service), and try the meatball sliders- they are exceptional.  I will definitely be coming back.

Gotta update my review to a 4.  I come here often if I'm looking to watch sports or grab a beer and am in the Henderson area.  There really is nowhere better for a pub atmosphere and rotating craft beer selection.  And their prices have actually gone down, where most beers on the menu cap out at $6, even for a usually more expensive double IPA or Belgian (used to be $7 or $8).  And I have failed to find a game that they could not put on the TV.  Nice staff, albeit sometimes tough to flag down for a refill, but they will change the channel for you and are helpful all around.  Great neighborhood bar; I wish they opened up another location in Summerlin.

I really like the vibe of this place. They have a huge selection of beer (draft and otherwise) The boyfriend was in beer heaven. He even got me to try a few. Great bartender, she quickly picked up on the boyfriends adventurous beer ordering, and started offering him different choices and brought him a sample or two. She was good. For food, we started with the Chicken Curry meat pie. I liked lt, and want to go back and try the steak one. Then we split the chicken Tikka Masala and the Sheperd's Pie. Both were pretty good. I love a good Sheperd's pie, but I was kinda stuffed by the time I got to it. The Chicken Tikka Masala was unlike any I've had before but good. I definitely want to try their fish and chips too. I'm sure we'll be back soon. 

Also, This place has a lot of themed nights. Wednesday there's trivia and a comedy something on another night

Your typical British pub, Shakespeare's offers over 100 different beers, some sort of event going on each night of the week, and decent enough pub food. At a joint like this I did not expect the beer list to be so extensive and I was pleasantly surprised. I have come here a couple of times for lunch and a few times I have come to partake in the Trivia Pub Quiz UYEs.

The food itself is what you would expect from a pub. Good not great, and sometimes you will have to wait a little while for it to come out of the kitchen. I found it quite interesting that their chicken tenders resembled the fish portion of an order of fish n chips, in that the batter used for the protein was identical. The saving grace for me was finding Poutine on the menu, which is a childhood favorite of mine. Can't go wrong with french fries slathered in hot gravy and topped with onions and cheese curds.


Events
Mondays: Comedy
Tuesdays: Trivia
Wednesdays: Trivia
Thursdays: Live Music
Fridays: Karaoke
Saturdays: Live Music
Sundays: Live Music

WoW what a great surprise that we found yesterday. We were looking for a new "venue" to watch the football games and decided on Shakespears Grille and Pub in Henderson, Nv.  When I first arrived I sat down and waaited for service which did not come right away I then noticed in the restuarant section of the building there was a soccer team with parents ages about 10 which explained our server being a little tied up. She did come over with a menu and took my drink order which the bartender over heard and began pouring my beer. Once I was joined by my friends our server Debbie came over and could not be more pleasent. As she was tending to other customers and or drinks were running low the bartender noticed this came out from behind the bar to help, great touch. 

The food was really good, one of us had eggs benedict, which I was told was fabulous, the other had shepards pie which he raved about. We split an order of nachos, really good layered perfectly. They had good beer speciaal and two for one bloody mary's, when the first one was finished the bartender noticed and brought over the second one, great service. 

One side note that was mentioned to was that even with about 12 kids playing pool and such the noise was not distracting. We will defintly return again, perhaps we can make into a BRONCOS bar!!

Great restaurant. Good food, and good wait staff. Jorge has waited on our large group (15+) many times, and always does a fantastic job. The pub has a local feel, and is smoke free-which is always a major bonus in Vegas!

I have never been here but my cousin and her husband are regulars at this place because they live right around the corner from it. They took me here tonight and the waiter Jorge was ridiculously terrible. This review will not be good and because of him I will probably never go back there again, my cousin even said she might stop going there because they had him the last three times and it was just the worst service ever. They ordered their beers and I let the waiter know that I needed a couple of more minutes because they have a really big beer list. He came back roughly 5 minutes later with their beer and as I was midsentence about to order my beer, he stormed off and walked away not even asking if I was ready. He Didn't come back to the table until roughly 5 to 7 minutes later. I ordered my beer and he was out of it so I ordered a different beer that he said he had. He came back to the table with a totally different beer that I didn't ask for. He said he was out of that beer that I asked for as well. What he should've done was come back to the table and ask me what I wanted instead of assuming what he thought I wanted. I ordered my next beer and he came back to the table with the original beer I asked for that he said he was out of in the first place. At this point I was fuming and there was nothing that was going to turn the service around. At the end of the night we asked for our check at three different occasions and still nothing. Oh and did I mention that he handed us everything we ordered instead of putting it down on the table!? Worst service ever and they were out of a lot of stuff!!! Terrible. I forgot to mention his snarky comments that he thought was funny but was actually just rude.

A little difficult to find, it's tucked into a corner in the shopping center on the corner of Eastern and Coronado. Sometimes GPS is just stupid! 
This is a cool bar that has trivia nights on Wednesday. The trivia was so much fun, but the questions were really off. Not what I expected, but had such a great time with about 20 Yelpers.
They offer and ton of beer (which I didnt drink) and a good amount of food offerings. It's a British pub (DUH!) so they have lots of british style food. 
They have a dart board (I think it's free) and an outside area to smoke in.

The service was good, although the waiter stiffed me on a penny. I dont like that! It's my penny, and if I want to leave it for tip, I will. I really didn't care because he was a very good waiter, I'm just mentioning it because of my Duane Reade experience.

I didn't order food, but I tried the curry fries and they were pretty good. Everyone said the food was decent.

I'll definitely be back for another trivia night, it was great. I just wish we knew more answers!

Food OK, service great, prices were good. A-OK to me!

I came here to meet up with a friend. I ordered the poutine, which I enjoyed. The atmosphere is pretty casual and laid back, and it's pretty amusing to watch and listen to the people singing karaoke. Very cool, local dive bar.

Went on a Saturday afternoon like 2PM. Ordered the shepard's pie, which was great...just wish it was a bigger portion. Not the cheapest place to eat, and beers outside of happy hour lighten the wallet.

I have been living in vegas for about six years and this has now become my go to spot after a hards night out of the kitchen.  I love this place. the atmosphere is awesome and their beer selection is on point.  They have the best bartender in vegas hands down.  Kelly is sweet and she makes the best drinks.  Anytime I go out for a drink I always know I will have the best night when i go visit Kelly at Shakespeare's.  I have been bringing some coworkers every few nights and they love it too.  this place is my go to.

Last night the hubby, daughter and I were looking for a new place to try and decided on Shakespeare's. I had heard good things about their so I convinced my husband to give it a try. We were hesitate due to it being a pub and we were worried they would frown upon our little one being in there. But when we walked in we were greeted with a friendly hello and were told we could sit anywhere we liked. The atmosphere was dark and quiet for a Saturday night but we liked that. And it was nice and cool in there which was a relief from the heat. Our waiter Jorge was great. He had a kids menu ready for our daughter and was very friendly to us. My husband ordered the fish and chips, I had the sampler platter, and the little one chicken pot pie. Everything was delicious. The fish had a nice crunch to it which I hear is important to fish and chips. My daughters pot pie was the perfect size for her. It had nice size chicken pieces in it plus it was loaded with veggies which she didn't mind. The sampler platter was just the right amount of bar food that I was looking for. We asked Jorge about their trivia night and he told us it gets pretty busy so to call ahead but that it's a really fun night. So I'm thinking that will be our next adventure to the pub. Thanks again for a great night. We will be back for sure.

American and pub fare is really good at Shakespeares. Staff are friendly and helpful and the kitchen staff are super great. Beer selection is good and they have great atmosphere. Good place for a cool night out.

Generally I come here on trivia nights which are a lot of fun. The beer selection is solid and the service here is very good even when they are very busy, if not a tad bit slow.

They run a lot of events and live music which makes it a lot of fun to come here. I met the owner and he was really friendly as well.

The reason I take away one star is that their food is good but not great. Some of their dishes are certainly better than others, but some seem expensive for what they are and it isn't as if the quality is particularly outstanding. Of particular note to me is the sausage rolls which are delicious. However, I had a meat pie and some other things and they were all just average.

The place is really big - maybe too big for its own good when they aren't running an event, but it does really fill up when they have something going on.

With great grief, it saddens me to give Shakespeare's Grille & Pub a 1 star, but I can't forgive a meal that may have been the absolute worst meal of my life.... This rating is 110% due to the food, as I would give the service a 4.5/5 stars. Unfortunately the food was probably the worst of my life (including fast food experiences), even in an intoxicated state where my standards are much lower :(
 
The Chicken Wings (6 wings for $10.99): My girlfriend ate the first couple, and half way into the 2nd one she asked me to smell it. Fortunately we both cook avidly and albeit this meal was a drunk one for me, I still expect fresh food to be cooked. The funky smell on this chicken (overpowering the habanero mango sauce) was an unmistakable sign that the chicken was bad when it was cooked. I (somewhat) understand using food that is on the verge of going bad but this chicken tasted as if it was well into the stages of rotting. 

The Philly Fries: Under cooked fries with dry/tasteless steak that may or may not have been reheated. Atop this was nacho cheese that tasted heated in a can. This meal did not coherently work and the cheese was much too runny for fries or steak. Overall it was not very good.

The Jalapeno Poppers: Best part of the meal. Maybe slightly over cooked but not terrible. Two reasons I say this: 1, the jalapeno could fall right out of the breading, with the breading strongly intact. 2, the cream cheese in the middle stayed extremely hot (burn your mouth hot) well after the outside had entirely cooled, like 15 minutes after they have arrived at the table. 


This post breaks my heart, as Shakespeare's used to be one of my favorite bars to frequent. Unfortunately I have not visited in a couple years and I don't believe I will be visiting again in the future :(

This place has really come along. Jeff is doing wonders here. Haven't found anything on the menu that hasn't been excellent and the Craft Beers are coming weekly now it seems.

The live music has started, on a small scale and will only improve the heads through the door. If/when the Drink Specials follow, this is going to be the Go-To place.

New Diners: Mention Yelp BOGO 1/2 Off Lunch Entree

Great fish n chips.  The fried pickles are a bit strange because they look like french fries, and they aren't the best I have ever had.  The service is fine when there aren't many people there.  It seems as if it is usually pretty short staffed.
Great place to hang out and relax! AMAZING apps!!! Their poitine is the absolute best!!!! If you don't order it you're really messing up!! Wish I lived closer so I could come here everyday!

We tried Shakespeare's again for the first time in a while and am happy to say that we had a great night.  There was a fun vibe with the crowd at the bar and we ended up chatting with several people that we had never even met before.  Our bartender, Tanner, also had some great recommendations about the menu and what beers would go best with the food we chose. Thank you for a fun evening. We will see you again soon.

Fish and chips would be 5 star if tartar sauce was home made and fries seasoned properly. Tartar sauce tastes store bought. Philly cheese steak meat is dried out and bland. Sandwich  only has meat and cheese no grilled onions or peppers.

Discovered this fantastic pub so close to home! Welcoming staff ( Shelley) and nice owners. Place is undergoing a remodel nightly when they're closed but it's not noticeable. 

Food is really very good. Tried the traditional British breakfast, Scotch eggs and the Poutine fries.  It was all great but we over ordered. Was warned the Poutine fries were enough for a meal but forged ahead and ordered them. Leftovers!  

Will be back often!

Awesome place to eat and drink! Also you can watch any football game there and they have individual speakers to listen what game you want! The sausage rolls are awesome and so are the hand rolled chicken fingers. So many beers to choose from and a full bar. Everyone is so friendly there as well! They have something for everyone different nights of the week. Check it out you won't be disappointed!

If I could give less than 1 Star I would. Worst service ever, waiting forever to get a drink order in. Finally we ordered everything. After waiting 25 minutes the waiter brought half of the drink order. We had enough and said we would leave just give us the check for the 2 drinks he did bring. He left again and came back 5 mins later and offered to come the drinks because the food was coming out.

We left.
First time at this establishment and horrible experience.  A packed place and one waiter?  Took 10 minutes for a menu and waited forever for a drink.  Bad experience, never coming back.

Don't bother to come to this place. The food is mediocre and I was overcharged for my sandwich and two drinks by $5 at Happy Hour. I questioned the sandwich and was told by the waitress that the extra $1charge was for fries. The menu clearly states that the order includes choice of fries. And no, she didn't take the $1 off. I didn't notice the overcharge on my drinks until I got home (my bad for not paying attention). I was charged $6/ea for 2 beers which should have been $4/ea at Happy Hour. In addition, the service was lackluster and we were the only table in the place.  Terrible place. Save your money and go somewhere where customers are appreciated and treated well!
Great food, nice service. Awesome selection on beers. Spacious  and comfortable. English nachos were killer!! Good job
When for lunch with my dad the place was calm, service was good, and the food was tasty. I had the steak and mushroom pie it was savory with good favors.

Been here a few times for trivia and once for karaoke and I really want to go back and just try it on a regular day. The food offerings are excellent--curry chips!--and the alcohol and beer lists are excellent. The bartenders and servers are great, too. This place really feels like a neighborhood joint which we seriously lack in our land of strip malls and stucco.

I have yet to have a bad experience here!

COMPLETELY SURPASSED MY EXPECTATIONS!!!
Came here simply to meet with some family and friends .. was greeted by Tanner who was probably the most attentive bartender/server I've ever encountered. Never had an empty drink. Drinks were always on point and the food... oh my lord .. coming to a bar you expect to only eat chicken fingers or food that isn't the healthiest.. Tanner went above and beyond and make sure I stuck to my diet and had me full and happy. On top of that he makes a MEAN MARGARITA AND OLD qFASHION( highly recommended). Thank you for your service tanner! My family and i will definitely be back and bringing more friends and family! 


Cheers

I go here for Trivia on Wednesdays. It's usually really crowded which makes the trivia atmosphere fun. However, if you go on a Wednesday, be prepared for long service and a somewhat rude server. 

My trivia group has been coming here pretty regularly, but the service hasn't gotten better. We usually get one server whose attitude is supposed to be a fun, laid-back nonchalance but he comes off curt and rude especially when you're hungry/thirsty. 

Food is alright, but there aren't a lot of vegetarian options. I wouldn't eat here without some event going on because the quality doesn't match the price.

Called in an order to go For Shepherds Pie for a friend who was down after surgery.  They said 20 minutes.  I arrived 30 minutes later and it wasn't ready.  After waiting 20 minutes I finally got my order.  So...  It takes 50 minutes to make an order to go??  And they forgot the side of HP sauce!!!  I quit going in here to eat because of lousy service, and the take-out is even worse.
Great atmosphere, good place to watch a game. Their food is excellent especially the corned beef and cabbage. Beer selection is outstanding and service was very good.

Fantastic local hangout. Stopped by for a late night bite. The bartender was friendly and helpful and got us some info on a local brewery tour. Fish and chips were delicious (not quite as good as England, but pretty damn good for America).

I get exactly the same thing every time I step thru their doors, Fish & Chips & a Guinness. Why, because it's just done really well here. Fish was cooked to perfection, crispy outside with tender, flaky fish inside. Chips are more like fries, but they serve their purpose. The Guinness is really smooth and at the right temperature to remind you that this is a UK based entrée. 

This business has many theme nights like trivia and sports based, so depending when you go it can get busy or louder than usual, so when I go for dinner I like to time things just right.

This last time I visited they handed us a beer menu. I had not seen this before and once glancing at it I now know I'll be changing my drink selections from time to time, as there were some interesting less vanilla choices available.

If you're a local, there's a coupon that's recently surfaced for a free entrée with a purchased entrée, so use that and enjoy more of their wonderful beer selections.

Thank you guys! See you soon!
We are huge fans of Shakespeare's!!  We come here at least once a week....between the great food, service and nice atmosphere it's become one of our regular hangouts!!  Keep up the great work

This is a nice bar! Great atmosphere, excellent beer selection, and friendly service. All four of us were disappointed in our food, however. We were here on a Friday and our server kept commenting on how busy they were, so that could have been a part of it. two of us had fish and chips, one had lamp sliders, and the fourth had a burger. None of us finished our plates. That being said, we will definitely be coming back for drinks, even if we don't come back for dinner.

Im not sure if this is owned by same owner from the one located in San Diego. 

The food was amazing and huge portions too. 

Our waitress could of been a lil more attentive when it came to refills but other then that it was great.

We would definitely like to try to the place again on our next visit.

We came here for dinner 2 years ago, the food was just ho-hum so never gave it another shot until I had a craving for fish and chips. When I searched through yelp this place came up so we decided to give it another shot. Wow... hubby and I ordered 2 fish and chips and the plate was so huge we could have probably shared one (but probably won't). Hands down one of the best fish and chips in town, better than the fancy gastropubs around the strip, as well. The fish was fluffy and flakey and wasn't swimming in oil. We were very impressed. Our server Andre had a full station and was zipping around the restaurant gracefully, schmoozing with patrons, being all sommelier, host and bus person by himself and didn't seem like in the weeds at all. Will definitely come back, don't know if I'll try other things in the menu but this will be my go-to spot for fish and chips for sure.

We've lived in Henderson for 12 years now and have never found a place we could call "ours".  Our place that has great and consistent food, great wait staff and clientele, and close by.  A place we can hang for beers and casual conversation and even play a little on the slots.  A place that has great beer and an ever changing selection on draught.  We finally found it at Shakespeare's!!!!  They have The Walking Dead on the TV on Sunday's!  What can be better!!!

Best selection of craft beer in the area, both draft and bottled.
Seems like trivia is pretty big here, but on a Friday night the crowd was pretty quiet. And not really a crowd.
The atmosphere inside is more restaurant-y than your typical PT's-type place (which is what we're used to in this area of town...boohoo). Moderately English.
They had a pretty great food menu for happy hour, where everything is $5. Got your standard bar fare like sliders and tacos and some more British-y takes like sausages in puff pastry (which is yummy).
I'm not gonna be a regular or anything, but it's nice to have something in my back pocket for beer in the neighborhood.

Hit up Shakespeare's after golf one day.  Had a few beers and a great lunch.  Added bonus, a University of Kentucky game was on.  Started with chips and curry then had the Pesto Chicken sandwich with EVEN MORE chips (tater wedges) and curry (spicy brown gravy).  Clearly, I enjoyed the curry, but it came back with a vengeance.  Had the worst indigestion of my life a few hours later.   You know that old saying about curry . . . just kidding.  If there is an old saying about curry, I don't know it.  But seriously, don't overdo it like me.   

I hear they have trivia on Wednesday nights too and the only thing I love more than UK and tater wedges with spicy brown gravy is trivia.

SOLID! 

I tend to frequent the local pub's to watch the English Premier Soccer games, and of course at this moment the World Cup action on daily. I have a thing for atmosphere, with a bunch of random good people whom are fans, eating good food, and watching great soccer...when that goal is scored for your team and throwing the high fives to your neighboring table it just makes the game that much better. 

I wanted to switch it up from my regular Crown & Anchor routine and being near Eastern and Anthem area anyway it made sense to look at Yelp to direct me here. It was a smaller attention game Japan v Columbia so arriving half hour before the game left the couch and comfortable chairs in front of the drop down open and was the ideal place to enjoy the game. If its a higher profile game i would recommend getting there early for a spot as i can tell that this place could be popular with 2 drop down screens and projectors and plenty of space to roam during the game. My server was Shelly, what a sweetheart! Pretty much made my afternoon with her attitude and service. I had the Fish tacos, and my partner in crime for the day enjoyed the Fish & Chips...fish batter is on point and crispy, although i like thinner crispy fries rather than wedge the wedges were still very tasty. Pretty much ties the best meal i've had during a game with Twin Peaks where i also had fish tacos. We also shared a dessert, a warm brownie with ice cream on top that was pretty tasty and finished out my meal perfectly. 

If your looking for a place to watch the game, and grab a good bite Shakespeare's delivers. Do check it out. 

Tomorrow is Germany v USA, and i know where ill be.
This place is awesome... fish and chips are a must!!!! Great place for any sporting event!

Where can you go in Henderson for good drinks and a good crowd past midnight? I thought the answer was NOWHERE until I found Shakespeare's! I finished a gig with my band one night around midnight on a Saturday, and thought "oh great, I'm hungry again and there's no place that I like on my way home. I'll probably eat at Roberto's again." But a friend that lives in Henderson took us here and I was pleasantly surprised. Decent food - I had the steak sandwich, decent selection of beers. But even better was the atmosphere - karaoke night and everyone was having a good time. It's not my top choice in town or anything, but I challenge you to find a better bar on the east side that serves food after midnight and actually has more than 5 people hanging out on a weekend. It's really a 3 star joint, but in a 2 star neighborhood it gets the bonus star for standing out.

I've been into trying beers as of late, but as much as I want to support places like this, I wasn't happy enough with the food.

Shakespeare's Grille & Pub is an English-styled bar just over the Henderson border of Eastern Ave. They're a sports bar - specifically a Steelers bar, if you're into that kind of thing - and were airing NFL games on the big projector and several smaller TVs on the penultimate Sunday of the playoffs. And if you're into craft beers, they have a handful available both on draft and on tap. Perhaps try a particular popular third-party beer-centric app and you could see that they regularly update their menu online in a timely manner.

I had a late "lunch" here with Michael K. He suggested that the Guinness draft ($5) was a good option here. so I started with one pint. It's about the same as I faintly recalled from the other time I'd had this (funny enough, also on an afternoon with Michael). The beer isn't too bitter, but the creamy. even silky texture is what would convince me to try it again.

I opted for something different for pint #2, an Oskar Blues Brewery draft called Hotbox Coffee Porter ($7). It's about as dark as the Guinness, but the ubiquitous coffee flavor of porters is in full effect with this craft beer. It's about as good as I've had in a "basic" porter.

Happy hour specials are available daily from 3 to 6 pm and from midnight to 2 am. We happened to visit during happy hour, so we ordered a plethora of $5 food options:

- Potato Skins: not very crispy or seasoned, perhaps relying on the bacon for flavor a bit too much
- Sausage rolls: underwhelming, with the "bangers" tasting like simple (allbeit satisfying) bratwurst and the pastry shell ending up more greasy than flaky. However, the horseradish mustard aioli was addictive and found its way into other dishes.
- Chips, Salsa & Whiz: simple, crunchy, prefab tortilla chips with a mild chipotle salsa and some liquid cheese product. Tasty, but the culinary effort is minimal.

Also, I had to check out the Poutine Fries ($8.99), which were perhaps a more competent take on the dish than some other local efforts. I still missed having crispiness on the steak fries, but the gravy and cheddar were plentiful, and the breaded/fried cheese curds were satisfying. I do wish that the cheese curbs were sized and dispersed more evenly, but I could see myself ordering this again barring a better local alternative (interestingly, Michael has already provided such a recommendation).

The game volume wasn't so loud that I couldn't have a conversation. The lighting was lackluster at most seats aside from the cozy booth which we'd located not far from the bar. Other patrons only got loud once or twice during the course of the football action.

I just don't see myself coming back to Shakespeare's for the food, and the beer variety is better than some places but not up to snuff with the real craft beer hotspots around town. It's a very solid neighborhood watering hole but not a destination.

Cool and dim inside....
The Creamy Vegetable soup- Hellah Good!!!! I would go there just for this soup, I wish the bowl was bigger.... For $5.00 it should be bigger!!!
The BF had Fish and Chips and it was pretty good, the big problem though was that the breading on the fish kept falling off- Dip one fish stick in the tarter sauce and all your crunchy breading is still in the sauce- That sucked...
I had the Pesto Chicken Sandwich- Pretty good too, I loved that they had potato wedges for fries- YAY!!!
I wish there were more food selections in the menu though...
We do plan on going back and actually trying their English Selections.
 
FYI if your name is Ursula like mine - the bartender's name is Ursula also so you will be hearing your name all through your meal- whether it's her introducing herself to customers or people calling her- It never failed everytime I heard "URSULA" I looked up even though I knew it wasn't me-Maybe one night all of us URSULA'S should go there and really cause some confusing sh** huh?
The customer service is really bad. Added items on my check that I never ordered. Why have a great patio when you don't offer a waiter to serve out there? I don't think I will be back.

One of my goals when I moved  to Las Vegas, close to 2 years ago now, was to find new places to venture to. To find great local places to call home and frequent  when I just didn't want to sit inside the house all night.  And when I find one I absolutely adore I just want to help out and promote the hell out of the establishment.

Shakespeare's Pub & Grill is one I feel deserves that type of promotion!

The first time I walked in the pub I thought I was definitely going to like it here.  First, It is a LOT bigger then it looks from the outside and since they added outdoor seating even more people can get the fantastic food they provide.  The pool table to the right and the dart board towards the back was my first indication and first good visual, as I scanned the entire place that this was definitely a true Pub.  As I walked up to the bar I heard the Jukebox playing 80's style music and instantly fell in love.  

The bartender at the time was awesome!  We talked all about the opening of the place and the history of the owner (who by the way is a great guy and has an excellent Scottish accent) And since then each bartender I've talked to has been equally fun and interesting.

The food!  Well I've only been back 6 times and can't stop from ordering the Guinness wings which are exceptionally tasty.  I've also had the Pear and Blue Cheese Salad (I couldn't keep my fork from diving for more) Every bite was equally great. Another time I ordered the Mozzarella and Tomatoes and rolled my eyes back with happiness, it was just a simple lunch.  

One of these days I will be able to have everything on the menu, but that is the fun of going back to a favorite spot.  

So go check out the Shakespeare's Pub.  Show a little love to a local Vegas place off the strip and enjoy the food and Pub experience!

Great place to eat and drink! Their Bangers & Mash was amazing! Bangers were big portioned and their Mash was really good. I love the fact that they have a good amount of TVs and a large projector with all of them displaying sports. The only thing that bothered me were the sticky/dirty tables and seats. Even though the surroundings and food were great, I did not feel clean and comfortable at all. Not sure if that's how the feel of the restaurant was supposed to be? But it could've been much more cleaner.
Had a nice lunch with my friends! The food was GREAT and large portions. Megan our server was amazing!! If you haven't been you need to go!!!

We had a group of friends meet at this adorable English themed bar for a going away party. What an awesome hidden gem! Great music, great food, impressive craft beer selection, outdoor seating avail, pool tables, darts, and trivia, and tons of tvs everywhere to keep you entertained. This is a pretty big place and perfect for larger groups. Our server Jorge (sp?) was on it! By the end of the evening our friendly, fun and attentive server felt like a part of our group. The bartenders were also super nice. Shakespears was a refreshing departure from some of the more popular bars here in Henderson that constantly fall short in terms of service. Love it and will definitely return

Pretty decent place to go watch football. They have a ton of TVs and usually some good bucket specials. 

I've been meaning to go to one of their Tap Takeover events, which sound fun. Lots of great beer on tap and in bottles. Not just a place to get a cold domestic lager -- although you certainly can. 

I've ate here a couple of times. Good bad food, but some of the specials are pretty bland. I got brisket once and that was a mistake. The old lady's mac and cheese was very good. 

Will have to hit one of the beer events. Thinking that will take my opinion up a notch.

If you're looking for a challenging Trivia spot, this is it. Out of all of the trivia spots in the city that I've been to, this was the one that really stumped our group. The age ranges from young 21 year olds all the way to the early baby boomers. The questions were a good mix to be fair for both extremes in age groups. Definitely a lot more history/former celebrities than pop culture. Perfect spot to bring your older parents! 
The happy hour is nothing special. It ends an hour before trivia night, but I wouldn't bother showing up early to get it. They have a special on trivia nights for 4$ all night, just stick to that, forget the happy hour. 
The loaded fries with steak were VERY filling. Cheap and definitely 2+ peoples worth. The beer was beer.

So super underrated little pub.  I actually think that I may have had the best salad i've had in the valley right in this pub!  It was a pear and orange salad.  But what really sold me on it were the candied pecans.  mmmm so worth the carb cutting!  It was absolutley dead the night I went becuase it was a weekday night and we were just driving by looking in.  The staff were super friendly and great.  The star was lost in that we weren't really greeted when we walked in the door.  There was a reception desk and I waited near it to be seated but no one came to do so.  So naturally we just wandered in and sat closer to the bar where we'd be visible and from that point on they were very accomodating.  Great giant screens and totally an irish pub to check out for St. Patty's day if ur trying to avoid the strip!  They said they are taking over part of the parking lot and hiring a band and i'm sure the festivities will be full of merriment!
best fish and chips in vegas, we were alone but service was great.My only problem was it smelled like an old casino fix that and you get 5 stars.I would recommend this place to anyone.

Came in on a Sat. night and it was someones 50th b-day! DJ pumpin and a packed celebratory house. 

About 26 special beers on tap and even more bottled beers.

The corned beef platter comes with shredded cabbage and cubed potatoes. Soft meat and served with a mustardy sauce on the side.

The savory meat pie was crazy good because of the amount of stew meat and the flaky, buttery heaven of a thick but light crust like a croissant, haha, but not. Maybe a croissants older brother on steroids. I digress.

Easy parking, great service and an eclectic selection of menu items. Want to try the chili and also the lamb sliders. Oh, still gotta try the fish n chips. It was a party here this night.
This place serves long islands that taste like watered down coke. I was very disappointed.
Did not feel like a pub at all.  Food was ok as was service.  I don't feel compelled to come back, to me this place was very average.

My home away from home. The new owners have done a great job cleaning up the place. My day would not be complete without seeing Shelly and Jaime.  And rock and roll bingo on Sunday with the family is great.

I LOVE good fish and chips and I SO wanted to like their's as they say its the best in town,...I thinks not.  I admit I did have a two for one coupon so we thought we'd give it a try.  We anxiously ordered the F&C's.  It looked good on the plate, large portions however they were both soaked in bad tasting grease as were the chips.  I was so disappointed as I had not eaten anything all day and was starved by the time I got there. But even with my iron stomach grumbling I couldn't eat it. And believe me, I can eat anything.  I know a few things about the restaurant business and cooking. First off I could tell the fry oil had not been changed in a while and they too may have been cooked at a a too low temperature which allows the fat to soak in the batter.  Also they were totally tasteless. I mean TOTALLY. I had to drench them in vinegar and leaned heavy on the tarter sauce to try to mask the bad oily flavor but they were just too permeated with grease to eat.  I politely told the waitress that they should change the fry oil and she told me they just did.  Believe me they did not.  Also I realize I was using a two for one coupon but she still should have offered to make it a better experience somehow. She did not. Also we asked to play a round of darts while waiting and all of the darts given to us were pretty much all broken.  Not good for a place that like to brag about being a traditional Brittish pub.When I got home we were sick to the stomach from the few bites we did eat. I'm considering calling them up today and asking for a refund minus the tip. I really don't want to go back for a "make up meal".  I'm hoping the owner reads this and realizes I don't mean to bash them, just draw attention to some major shortcomings. I hope he fixes them as I'd like nothing more than this local business to thrive.. Despite the 2 for 1, the bill still came to about $30 including tip (which I always base on the amount before any discount.)  I really hope they step up their game.
Best food ever. Fish n chips melt in your mouths. Wonderful fries n cole slaw. This is a must go to place u cannot go wrong

I followed Shannon the bartender from her previous job because she always gave me great service and when she mentioned they have tons of craft beer, of course I was going to go check it out as I love IPA, Imperial IPAs and so on. I can't say enough on how awesome this place is. There is no smoking which automatically rates it a 5 star, and Cory as well as Justin are great owners. They take time to hear suggestions for different booze and take care of their dart boards which I love. They were some crappy Coors Light boards but they upgraded to DMI Bandits which are staple free. I'm hoping they start some sort of dart league or tournament in the near future to take part in. They have the newest Golden Tee which is also a great addition. The next best thing would be a Power Putt LIVE machine, then I'd live at this bar!

Anyway, go check this place out but for the best bartender in town go see Shannon on Monday, Friday, Saturday or Sunday night! She may occasionally have others but it's a toss up.

GOGOGOOO@*&(P*&^%$#@!~

Omg! The beer. The food. The service! Everything was excellent!!! 1 page of draft beers and 5 pages of bottled beer. Enjoyed the English nachos, fish and chips, and a rueben...all of it was fresh, hot, and incredibly delicious!

Delicious beer!  Yum!  A cool spot, spacious and clean often with live music or trivia games.  My wife and I would call this our favorite neighborhood pub because it's super close and always good.  Waitress Angel is always so nice and everyone else we have encountered has been friendly as well.  The food is good, but not amazing, although my wife loves the fish and chips.  The real English mustard is great, though, and there is darts and billiards.  A really great bar!

Had an amazing time here, the bartender was personable and friendly and the food was delicious! It's a great laid back atmosphere - I could stay for hours! My fiance from England highly approved and he knows very well what a good pub is! ;)

i just ordered through ubereats and the food was hot!!! the philly fries were yummy and the sampler platter we enjoyed the chicken wings and beer battered  chicken fingers !! we will be eating here again!!! not to mention its 2 am and the food was good thumbs up!!!

Loved the FOOD!
This place has great food and good beers on tap, happy hour is ok with cheap tacos ($2 I think) and cheaper beers.  Ambiance is cool with the Shakespeare theme/sports bar.  I especially liked the games you can play (jenga, checkers, backgammon etc) while you wait or watch the game.  Overall I really liked it, it is a bit more expensive than some sports bars but the quality of the food and maybe a coupon/cert make up for it!

Tried this place for the first time! We were really impressed by the amazing service and the quality of the food! Awesome Ruben sandwich and the Caribbean salad had better and more fresh ingredients that most restaurants. Great atmosphere- very fun and good vibes all around. Awesome selection of beers as well. I also love the no smoking .

Great location in Henderson. Has two steel tip dartboards :-)) 10 TV's of which 2 are big-screens. Pool table. Food was very good with hardy portions. Mega beer selection (they have a 9 page drink menu). Barmaids courteous and good looking. Defiantly good for large parties. Can't think of anything negative to post? I will for sure be returning in the future and telling my friends about  Shakespeare's.

First (and foremost), make sure you check in when you visit. They offer a free pitcher of beer to anyone who checks in, which is a much better promo that any other place I've been to.

This is an AWESOME little grill and pub.  The food is good, the drinks are strong, they have a ton of drink options (all reasonably priced, too), and the atmosphere is perfect.  I love pubs because you can enjoy an evening with friends without having to scream at each other to have a conversation.   

Shakespeare's is great because it has something for everyone.  Inside, there's music/ karaoke, tables, and booths.  Outside, there's a great fenced off area.  While we were there, people were playing beer pong outside.

Everyone that worked there was very friendly.  They were really quick to fill our orders, and were great about clearing tables and asking if we wanted another round.  It was really busy because it was Halloween, but you still felt like you were getting premium service.

We will definitely be back!

I really like this place. Came in to watch football....came early and the bartender put the game I wanted on Score!....then at half time she tells me the owner is here we putting on the Patroits. Ok cool. I look around.the bar No one is watching just gambling....I hate homer shit Patroits Cowboys.......guess I will take my ass to PTS

I use to come here several times a week but this was my first time since the ownership has changed. First of all, the place looks INCREDIBLE! Second, my favorite bar tender, Lucia was here and I could not ask for anyone more attentive and friendly than her. The menu has been upgraded, the food has exceeded my expectations, and that girl pours some AMAZING cocktails! Make sure you check out the new Shakespeare's and ask for Lucia- you won't be disappointed!

Previous reviews no longer apply..this great pub is recently under awesome new ownership.The owners are Vegas locals and will make this pub the place to be..the food is awesome, the staff is great. Checking out trivia tomorrow at 7 pm...awesome pub....

Been here a few times and the food is GREAT...lots of tv's around and also a huge projection screen always showing the games...Tiffini the bartender is the BEST, her alcohol knowledge is amazing, she can make anything you ask or at least suggest something similar to your liking if not better, always see the owner Cory making his rounds of the place and greeting the guests, there's always something going on each night, including trivia & karaoke!

Discovered this place via a friend who works in the food/beverage industry. 
The food:  They have happy hour 7 days a week. My favorite happy hour item is the chicken tenders. Or the chips and curry. However, my favorite overall is the chicken curry meat pie. OMG, the curry. I crave it daily. Sooooo good. Fish and chips are great as well. My husband really likes the sliders and the Caribbean chicken salad. During football games they have $15 buckets of sliders/wings/tenders with fries. My inner fat kid is always happy on game days. 
Staff:  I love the staff. My drink glass never gets empty. I can come here, tell the bartender "I like rum and fruity drinks" and they can whip up something delicious and strong. YUM. The owner is often around, mingling with the rest of us and asking how things are going. He is a true beer aficionado. I have seen him sit with my husband for 15 minutes talking beer. He always asks for recommendations on what we would like to see on tap, and my husband likes to think that's why the 90 min Dogfish IPA is on tap (lol, his personal fav). 
Gaming:  The machines here are gold pass poker machines. I enjoy them. Never struck it rich but I usually walk out even. They just got 2 brand new dart boards which is where we spend most of our time. 
Entertainment:  They have quiz trivia, comedy nights, and live music events. I like coming here on Sundays and relaxing on their couches to watch the games. They also have a pool table and Golden Tee, neither of which I've used. 
I'm here for the food, the strong drinks, and the service. Highly recommended.
English American pub not bad breakfast better than expected.  Decor is nice the Pub is clean and no smell. Seems like it would be a nice place to hang out if you are looking call home away from home.

Great food, beer, and karaoke! You can't go wrong with that combo for a Friday night. I am NOT a poutine fan, but some people in our group wanted to try it, so we ordered the poutine. I will admit that their poutine is actually good. And this is coming from someone who hates gravy!

If you are here during karaoke, please stick around. People were singing very eclectic songs (from The Rolling Stones to the Beach Boys to Def Leppard) but they were all fantastic!
Overpriced drinks for a bar and grill. $8 wine?! Poor service...didn't bring water when asked, barely visited our table. I won't be back.
Food is excellent, however a bit pricey for a Pub. Have been several times now, haven't had anything I wouldn't gladly order again.

This place was dead when we went on a Friday around 4 o'clock but the happy hour was pretty good.  $2 light beers and a $1 off other drafts.  There are a few food specials for $2 as well and on Monday and Friday the happy hour starts at 2 o'clock.  The restaurant/bar are pretty big and there are both high and low tables to sit at.  The waitress was on top of it and was always quick to refill our drinks.  They have a lot of English/Irish beers on tap and even a few craft beers like Lagunitas and Stone.  If you want a good happy hour and a quiet place to hang out, this might just be the place.

Out in Henderson for the Ironman 70.3, came across this place on yelp, was not disappointed. The poutine was delicious. I had the fish & chips, HUGE portion, others had shepherds pie, Philly cheesesteak & salmon club. Everyone said their food was great. Quick friendly service, I'd come back :)

Walked in for the first time and they had multiple TVs playing sports and a Dj playing Frank Sinatra? It was quite interesting. The music did get livelier after an hour or so. They've got darts and pool. Walked up to the bar and asked Andre the bartender what IPAs they had. He was friendly and helpful. I picked Stone as my nightcap. I didn't order any food but it sure did smell good.

One of the best little pubs in the area. I usually come for a pint or two with my girlfriend after a long day. Really amazing selection for drinks here, and the food is definitely worth coming back for. Each night something good is happening here, my favorite day is Wensday, which is quiz night ( I've won a few times and have gotten great beer related prizes).

I am not a fan of this place.  To begin with, I didn't like the beer selection which was mainly infusion type beers.  In my opinion, a good hefeweizen should not have blueberries in it!  Also the food wasn't very good.  Our lamb chops were over cooked and did not have much flavor, and the brown gravy for the mash potatoes was too salty.  In addition, it took a long time for us to get our food after the waiter took our order.  So obviously I will not be a repeat customer.

UPDATE: The owner or manager has recently informed me that this pub has over 200 beers.  It would have been nice if my server had told me that; all he did is hand me a beer menu with far fewer than 200 selections.  So I guess poor training/management of employees is another reason to avoid this place.
Very disappointing.  Menu mid-afternoon seemed very limited; quality of fish & chips was poor. Very greasy, mushy fish and thoroughly lacking in flavor!

Went here with my folks. Fantastic fish and chips. Mom had the lamb chops yum. Dan had meatball sub with sweet potato fries. 

Great beer selection. We shared a Belchnig Beaver Peanut Butter stout. Wow!!! Amazing flavor!!  Mom had the cider very refreshing.

The food is amazing. The beers are amazing. Our server, Sarah, was incredible! She was the best. Got the chicken tenders and they were honestly the best tenders I've had. Stop by for some amazing food and drinks, and ask for Sarah. She's amazing! :)

Check in on yelp and you get 50% your second entree you order!

This place is a casual pub/ bar located right next to sushi wa on Coronado and Eastern. I cannot really rate the beers since I was here for lunch and it was too early to drink. I ordered the fish n chips  which consisted of two large pieces of battered fish and coleslaw and potato wedges. I was very impressed how the fish was battered and fried to perfection. The fish itself was crunchy and not soggy. The potato wedges and coleslaw was delicious as well. The service was great, she was very pleasant and had a great personality. She did not forget about me even though i was sitting outside enjoying the beautiful weather. 

Overall I had a great experience with this place, I definitely  will go back to dine in the evening and to try out the beers. This looks like a great place to relax and chill with friends.
Best fish and chips in town by far!  Relaxing atmosphere. Great friendly service. My husband loves there large beer selection.

I stopped in here to get take out because I was staying across the street at the Hilton. I really liked the atmosphere here, kind of a generic British Isles theme with a variety of paeans to the Bard, obviously. The service was friendly and fast. There were probably a dozen patrons on the Wednesday evening I was there. They seemed to have a solid English pub menu; I'd like to have tried more. What I did try was the pear and blue cheese salad with grilled chicken (added at the waiter's suggestion), and it was great. Wish I'd had time to tip back a few cold ones and hang out here a while.

Glad to know there is a place that serves decent fish and chips in this town. We found them based off of other Yelp reviews...Thank you for that! The food is good hearty and full of flavor, it maybe not be as authentic as most pubs by way of atmosphere, but they deliver on quality of food and service, The chips are excellent the beer cold and yes the Guiness on tap is like an "old friend" in a glass. Try it if you crave pub comfort food or just want to chill in a friendly neighborhood place, for some beer and pool.
Again, fish and chips did not deliver, fish was small, and only two sticks, with too many fries to compensate. Not worth 15 dollars.

This is probably my favorite Fish and Chips place  to go! Always consistent and never greasy! Five Stars for you !! I love your Fish and Chips! I've been to London and they don't compare to yours at all!!  I don't even know what your other items are in the menu because your Fish and Chips are Great!!

So the food is inconsistent,  the service is pretty bad because they never have enough people working, but the drinks are good and the atmosphere is great.   Its one of those neighborhood bars that you'll come back to over and over because everything is really chill and laid back.

I'd give this place 3.5 stars, but can't...

This place is great. I love that it is non-smoking! They have great food and the bartenders are very nice and take good care of the customers. It's a great place to watch games. They have darts and a pool table as well as an outdoor patio.
Great hangout great beer options food is great as well... pool tables and dart boards.. Fun place to tie one on... It if Friday night and they are doing karaoke funny people watching!!

I'm a big fan of this place. It's a nice low-key atmosphere, and the food is fantastic. I usually get the fish in chips, but I've tried most things on the menu and haven't found something that's not really good yet. I can also attest to the battered chicken tenders appetizers. 

Service is really great as well. Casual and friendly. 

Side note, and not really the fault of the establishment. I was eating there once when some strange woman who was eating with her friend next to us wondered over to our table and starting asking questions about our meals. We assured her it was good. At this time she took out her phone and started taking pictures of our plates. She finally noticed the WTF look on our faces. She then told us, in an official sounding tone usually reserved for fire marshals, that it's ok because she was a "foodie". Very odd.

A group of us met for dinner & shared 6 different items...they were all Uh-May-Zing!!! I'm so sad I live in a different state & can't go back all the time!! The Tikka Misala & Fish & Chips (wedges) made my mouth happy to be alive! Even the Chicken fingers were fantastic. Great job guys...looking forward to our next trip to Vegas so we can meet there again. We asked for tons of sides, refills, special requests &  our server took them all in stride; great service...Cudos Jorge!! Looking forward to coming back!

There's nothing that disappoints me more than high hopes for a place being shattered by poor service, and bland food. 

My first review of Shakespeare's expressed my extreme disappointment, about 4 months ago. 
A day or two after the review was posted, I received a private message from the management team, sincerely apologizing for the bad experience, and letting me know that the website had been updated to correct the issue that caused a good part of the snafu last time.

We had considered coming back out to try Shakespeare's again, because lets face it: many business owners could have (and would have) responded in a much more negative way.  Shakespeare's however, took it as constructive criticism, and wanted to make it right.  That kind of attitude goes a long way with me.  The only problem was, that its SO far from where we live!

Well, last night, we found ourselves heading to Shakespeare's for the "Watching Dead" viewing party.  

Let me tell you, the experience was NIGHT AND DAY. 

We were greeted warmly by the manager, and by our server.  We were checked on frequently.  I observed the other servers, and they all seemed to be interacting positively with a very packed house.   

Shall we talk about how amazing the food was this time?  
We had:

Honey Sriracha wings:  Delicious.  Tender.  Spicy.  Sweet.  Excellent cook.
Beer Battered Chicken Tenders:  wow!  The breading was incredible.  Tender Juicy chicken, and not super greasy, like other places. 
Fries/Chips with curry sauce:  really really really nice!  I love a good curry dipping sauce, and this was great. 
Angus Beef Sliders: Beef was really well seasoned, and well cooked. 
Beef and Veggie Meat Pie:  A revelation.  My absolute favorite dish of the night. Fella and I were splitting it, and I almost didn't let him have any!
Sausage Roll: Fella wasn't a fan (he doesn't usually care for meat in a pastry), but I devoured it.  The sausage was great!
Jorge's Pub Mac n Cheese:  Second favorite of the night.  I'm a mac n cheese elitist.  I don't like things in my mac n cheese, and I'm REALLY picky about it.  This.  Was.  Phenomenal.  I will be back JUST for this dish.  Creamy mac n cheese, crispy bacon, and jalapenos (which I avoided eating whole, since I don't like a lot of spice, but the flavor of the dish...oh my goodness, this is a winner!)
Jalapeno Turkey Burger: This I didn't try, as there is avocado on it, and I'm allergic, but Fella ate it, and just raved!  It was his favorite of the night, right up there with the meat pie and the mac n cheese.   He said it was seasoned really really well, and was tender and delicious. 

I'm really glad that we gave Shakespeare's another chance.  Sometimes, places just have a really off day, and it seems that this was the case here.  

Thank you again, Shakespeare's, for the great service last night, and the amazing food.  We'll be coming back again, soon.

Best fish and chips and tartar sauce ever!  Bangers and Mash and Shepherd's Pie are great as well... and Smithwick's is on tap.  The only reason I didn't rate this at 5 stars is the slow service.  Just have some patience when you go here and you'll enjoy the food tremendously.  We've never had a bad experience at Shakespeare's.

Upon entry, our eyes needed a moment to readjust from the glaring midday sun to the dimly lit interior of the pub. After stumbling about for a bit, my husband and I settled in a booth next to the bar. A friendly waitress greeted us quickly to hand us a few menus and take our drink orders. With a request for a good IPA, she returned with no less than three tasters in hand. Impressive! Lunch was off to a great start (especially with Whitesnake playing on the jukebox!).    

GRILLED CHEESE ($6.99): I went with wheat bread and steak fries as my side. A simple rendition of the classic but perfect for the price-point. 4/5

THE RACHEL ($11.99): Husband described the size of this turkey ruben sandwich as "ridiculous". He could only eat half. He went with sweet potato fries as his side. 4/5

The waitress at Shakespeare's was awesome and the grub was good. My only gripe was that there was a noticeable lack of vegetarian options on the menu. A veggie burger option would be amazing. A girl can dream, after all.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #60

Nice restaurant. Don't get me wrong. The food was good. And would have been better had my burger be cooked medium well like I ask. And had I been given steak fries instead of skinny fries. I was going to move to the bar and gamble while I waited on my husband to smoke. But unfortunately she didn't return with the to go box until he was done smoking. And it would be nice if the tables were actually under a light. Had to move my table so I could see my food. Beer was cold if not expensive. $4 for a domestic $6 for an import. And the menus could have used a wipe down.  And the poor lady behind the bar could have used help.

We're looking for a new bar close to our house. So far we haven't found a winner. We came here when we at last minute had a babysitter. This place was a very good first experience. We got apps and salad, and both were very good. We came here, mostly because I love hanging out with my husband, but I prefer to be doing something while at a bar. This bar had several options. Darts, pool, and we even saw a large jenga set. 

The reason this is probably going to be our new go-to local place, is that there is no smoking! Most bars get around that by walling off the food area from the smokey bar. Yuck. It was so refreshing to be at a place and not go home stinking (we've previously live in Chicago and NH so we are not used to smoking in bars anymore). 

Also, the night we were there someone was celebrating something, and they had hired the karaoke dj to play. It was fun watching that, and anyone could go up there. 

We'll definitely be back!

Similar batter for fish as your chicken tenders? Why, yes, please. I like that their batter is thinner than most places, comes out crisp, and keeps the chicken moist. My friend and I had came here after lounging around Crepe Shack for a few hours. Dessert before dinner had landed us right outside of the happy hour window. Come before 7pm on the weekdays and the appetizers are a couple dollars cheaper. The serving sizes are smaller, so the deals did not look that appealing. There are definitely better deals out there. 

The whole Great Britain area does know how to produce good fried items. The chips are also delicious. Big wedges, sprinkled with parsley goes well with a splash of vinegar. Our pints of Guinness and a Snake Bite are reasonable at $6 each. Some of the drinks are on the crazy expensive price. Even the Irish bars on the Strip do not charge some of these prices. 

For $26, we got two drinks, chicken fingers, and chips. Not bad since we could not finish off all of it. It is just a lot of heavy food. 

I liked how honest the bartenders were. When we asked about the menu he rattled off about how some of the items are skimpy and which are the best. I appreciated the honesty.
Awesome Philly Cheese Steak!  We love this bar... great company, drinks, and delicious food! Do yourself a favor and check it out.

We came here looking for a local pub/bar that had craft beer and we found a fun little local place!

It's too bad we'd just missed their 7pm trivia on Wednesdays and Tuesdays (we came around 9pm) but we heard that it's a super fun time and WILL be back!

There's even a winner's circle table for the winners that has its very own beer tap in the middle!

We tried out the scotch egg (a favorite of ours) and also their Honey Sriracha wings which were very crunchy and delish. For beer, we shared the Rogue Brewery Lemon Chiffon Cruller and also each had a second beer (sorry not sorry) - I had a Hawaiian wheat and hubby had a Hefe - both were delicious.

I am not a girl who digs domestic beer - I can grab that at the grocery store if I really had a hankering - I love to treat beer like I do food and experience local flavors and small brewery tastes so this was a welcome find and treat!

This place can suck it! If you don't want to make food to go, take your asses off Postmates and quit accepting orders and then canceling them 15-minutes later. You guys are clowns that can't seem to figure out how to run a food business.
Loved it!! Will have to visit friends again so we can head back. Great pub food, good Bloody Mary!

We've eaten here before and been pleased with the food, although the service has been slow. This evening, however, we walked out after sitting for nearly ten minutes without so much as an acknowledgement from a server. Even a simple wave as indication that we'd been noticed would have been an improvement.

The food is good, but I can get good food at any number of places in town. The service here is just not good enough for me to recommend them to anyone else.

If it weren't for the phenomenal food, this would have been an easy one star. Apparently, it is a huge burden to exercise courtesy here. The bartender with the half shaved head acted as if I was really putting her out when I asked her if we could sit anywhere...I waited patiently to ask her while she was having a conversation with a guy that lasted 5 minutes or so. We just stood there waiting for her to finish her story so she could acknowledge us...finally she looks at me and says what do no need? just the beginning...waiter shows up after 10 mins, hands us two menus and instantly asks if we know what we want. We give him our drink orders, and ask him to give us a couple minutes to look at the menu. He does, we order, food comes up pretty quickly...dude drops our food off, and never came back...I tried flagging him down with head nods, hand gestures, smoke signals, etc., and even had the opportunity to say excuse me sir once when he was at the table next to us taking an order, but he ignored us. He showed back up to drop off a check, at which point I was irritated, and asked if he had forgotten about us. He laughed and said no. I didn't laugh and said that I haven't seen you since you dropped our food off. It was delicious, but I needed a side of gravy, and refills about a half hour ago...to this he said nothing. Literally just stood there with a look. Finally, he says do you want a refill, to which I reply yes! I've been thirsty for 30 minutes. Honestly, I haven't decided if I'm going back or not.
Best place ever they are always great with events. Love the karaoke night! Love the staff! Awesome experience!

The service here is absolutely awful. We came in for trivia about 4 or 5 times, and tonight was our last straw with this place. We've had two different waiters/waitresses, and they all have the same stupid attitude ("Can we have menus please?" "maaaaybe"). This wouldn't be so bad except every time they forget the menus! 
The food itself is pretty decent for bar food, if you can convince your waiter to take your order - and assuming they remember the order. Every time we've been here, they've either gotten someone's order wrong (I realize this could be a mixup in the kitchen too, but still), or they just blatantly forget to bring something. 

A few examples of what this establishment apparently considers "service":
One of our servers was just blatantly rude - someone at our table ordered a drink ("could I get a vodka cranberry please?") and he responded with "No" and walked away. I get it, you're supposed to be the cool, laid back server that will joke with us - but that only works if you actually do your job. He never brought the drink, even after being reminded once. On a separate night, he brought out the wrong order (someone ordered chicken tenders, he brought chicken nachos). Instead of apologizing and taking the order back to be replaced, he put the nachos down in front of her, said "I SWEAR I heard nachos", and walked away.
Our waitress tonight took 15 minutes to bring us menus (she was chatting - not busy with other customers). She tried pulling off the 'adorable girl' attitude on us, which again may have worked if she did her job. We never got drink menus, waiting another 10-15 minutes to order food, and even then the orders were messed up.

This is literally the only place I have ever gone and not left a tip. My entire group are good tippers, and even with poor service tip at least 15% (and that takes pretty poor service for us to leave that little). After leaving the bare minimum the last few times, tonight was the last straw - for the first time in our lives, we left $0 tip. That's how awful the service is here.

I like the food, I love the trivia, but I will never be coming back here. Spend your money somewhere where there's good service - or hell, even poor service is better than this place.

I came here in search of some English cuisine, which this establishment doesn't have much of. There were just a handful of "English favorites" and the rest of the menu was your typical pub food. All that being said everything down to the service was phenomenal! I had the Reuben which came piled HIGH with some of the best corned beef and delicious thick slices of rye. We also had fried pickles which were awesome. The fish and chips came with two GIANT pieces of cod and my wife's grilled cheese was also solid. Besides all of that the one thing I will make sure to note due to its importance is that the steak fries were cooked to perfection! Just slightly crispy on the outside and perfect in the middle. The only other thing I can complain about was that we got there later in the evening(9pm) and the music was really loud, luckily they had outdoor seating which was really nice so we could enjoy our last meal before we head back to Boise tomorrow morning. I would eat here again given the opportunity, and I think you should as well!

I'm definitely a fan of Shakespeare's - they have a great vibe and awesome beer selection. So why only 3 stars? I was in there recently and left with a bit of a bad taste in my mouth because whoever was in charge kept skipping all of the songs on the jukebox that he didn't play. Not that each song is so expensive, but it's still MY money and it's a jerky thing to do.

Other than that - this place is pretty great. On Sunday nights they host a cool music/trivia/bingo event that I would definitely suggest checking out. The food is good and there is a pool table as well. They recently remodeled a bit and there are now large booths and lots of seating, along with the huge bar.

The service we received was excellent, Shelley was very friendly & helpful.

The pub itself was just looking a bit old/tired.

We came here to watch the World Cup semi final and they do have plenty of screens (although the projectors are not as bright/sharp as would be ideal).

The food just wasn't very good/authentic at all.

The bacon in the "Full English Breakfast" is american style (I didn't order it, but was disappointed to hear that).

I had the sausage rolls which were very "heavy/stodgy" the meat had next to no flavor and perhaps the pastry just wasn't cooked long enough?

The poutine had some breaded cheese curds which did not help the flavor/texture (as the gravy just made them very soggy).

The shepherds pie was decent - the smaller lunchtime size was big enough for me.

They do have HP sauce and malt vinegar on all the tables which is a nice touch.

My wife had the fish & chips (which really is fish and wedge fries - and seasoned wedge fries which is just odd).  The whole meal kind of looked like it was from Sysco.

I would not head back here - and also would not say that their food is representative of good English pub fayre.

HOLY BALLS. I love Poutine. I'm talking OBSESSED. The Poutine here as amazing. The curds are fried, the Guinness Gravy is slamming, and the fries are just the right amount of potato.

The amount of craft beers is pretty solid. Lots I haven't seen and many more I have. Lots of bottles to choose from.

The place itself can get pretty full and loud because they have a trivia night here. It's pretty cool, but hard to get seated. Check ahead.

I have been going to dealer school next door for a month and after I got my certificate, a few of us went over to Shakespeare's to have a celebration beer (or two.)  I was shocked at the size when I walked inside..it's much bigger than it looks from the outside.  It was very cute and cozy too.  We all got food and beers and the waitress/bartender gave us separate checks without us even asking for them.  She was very patient with us while we ordered all at different times since some people joined us late.

I thought the food was very good.  I got the fish tacos which came with a salad.  I was very surprised at how good the food was.  After we ate, we played pool for a few hours.  At a buck a game, it was cheap entertainment.  There was a band playing that was okay, but before they set up, the bartender had some blues going on the juke box that I really liked! 

I will definitely be going back.  The food was great, the atmosphere was cozy and warm.

Oh and the best part:  NON Smoking! =)

Cool little Irish pub. The place is rather large. Great place for a everyday spot to grab a drink and a burger. The food is not bad. It typical pub food. The menu could be designed a bit better as it is a bit hard to read but other than that its all good. The service was friendly. Our drinks came out fast. The place was kinda slow but they have themed nights. Will definitely be back.

Irish pub sports bar that serves exactly what I wanted off the Vegas strip.  I came in because I had a haircut appointment nearby in an hour, and noticed they had a lunch menu with a smaller shepherd's pie, my favorite gastropub thing to order. 

The food came out quickly and was perfect.  Service was fast and friendly.  I was a happy camper!

3.5 stars for food 

Fish and chips are $15 yet there's only 2 pieces of fish (though they are delicious pieces of fish). There were a pile of chips, though, which were good but not great. 

4 stars for service
