Sat in the bar and had great service. My beers slowed down when it got really busy, but my server was still very helpful with deciding on one of the 100+ beers. Even when it got busy, he was still fairly attentive. 

5 stars for entertainment (on Saturday night)

A great band called Rev It Up started around 9. There was an uncalled for number of "check check 1 2 3" happening for more than 30 mins which was super annoying but once they started, I forgave them for it. They sang great classic rock tunes. Plus they're awesome with a saxophone, trumpet, and trombone along with keyboard, guitar,  and bass. Don't hear bands like that in just any pub. 

This was my first time here and I really enjoyed myself. I was in town for work and this was a really enjoyable way to spend a Saturday night before an early flight home.
Good full bar, friendly bartenders, friendly staff. Food looked good what ppl was eating. Looks like the fish and chips are a hit there.

So so food. Had to send back a sandwich twice. But they were very nice about it. I agree with who ever posted the comment a few weeks ago about them putting up stickers blighting the neighborhood on street signs and light poles.

It's Friday night and almost 7pm And we decided to check out this local bar.

Thera a lot of parking which was great cause if I can't find a spot... it's on to the next one. 

Outside the bar there's an enclosed areas which I believe on a hot day or the bars full, you can step outside and have a smoke and grab some fresh air or just hang out outside. 

Walking in, it's pretty open and you have to walk all the way in to get service. 

Inside we found the dining areas was pretty full, to the side there's pool tables and two dart boards and next to that is a jukebox And at least 6 TV's showing NCAAF, MLB and NHL.

We sat at the bar and ordered some beers and I ordered the meat pie and hubby ordered the wings. 

I will say this ... if you want to start your night off early with food and drinks come here.. maybe things get crazier later ...but by 8:30 it was still quiet for a Friday night.

The best part about my visit was the meat pie! 
I'm an Aussie and I think I just found my meat pie HotSpot! I'll be back to to eat, but that's about it.

I was there the other day the place was half full two nice bartenders kinda nice......not like the previous lady ...we had an issue with the bill we use a Groupon even if order from happyhour  with out realize the was over  it feel like I was supposed to been told ..:Sorry but happy hour is over "
No big deal ...and at the end I give my CC with out looking at the final bill .... ups the bill was not adjust properly.
The had to run my CC AGAIN.....not big deal ... I have more than $20 on my card ...lol
BUT WENT I WAS TALL THAT IT WILL CLEAR AT THE END OF THE  NIGHT...
I I knew that wasn't the truth .
anybody can make a little mistake.
Oh yeah we'll be back I really love to cheeseburger the Guinness reduction sauce oh my god very tasty I had my with blue cheese crumbles it very unique flavor

Can here mid afternoon after running some errands.  Have driven by plenty of time and finally decided to see what it was all about.  From the beer to the food it was just average.  Not bad but not memorable.
Great place to hang out after work with some friends. Fun atmosphere with a great craft beer selection. Ask for my old buddy of many years, Ray!

This restaurant/poker bar/pub (nonsmoking!) recently changed ownership, and the menu and decor were updated. My favorite changes are the quality of the food and Match Play Mondays. Daily happy hour includes some excellent tacos (2 for $5, fish or chicken) that are really a great deal. I believe Match Play Mondays is a new offering too. They match anyone's deal you bring in up to $100. I've gone many times for this deal and I hope they keep it going! 

The beer selection is most amazing- over 100 total between bottled & a rotating draft list. Brews include many local faves such as Joseph James Rye'd n Dirty, Big Dog's Dirty Dog IPA, Tenaya Creek Pilsner. There was an offering from Lovelady Brewing also when I was there recently. Other standouts I've had are Belching Beaver Peanut Butter Porter & local seasonals such as CraftHaus. 

The bar area is actually quite nice and stays true to the British pub theme. There is plenty of seating in the dining area, and they have a Skee-Ball machine whose prizes include drinks, a burger and a T-Shirt. I think there's a dart board also. They have weekly theme nights, such as Brainstormer Trivia on Wednesdays and karaoke on Fridays. 
A nice place for grabbing some cheap happy hour food and enjoying whatever type of beer you may desire!

Had an English friend visiting us so we thought we would give this place a try and we were not disappointed.  The beer was cold and fresh and the selection very large.  We then decided to eat and had the following selections:  Fish & Chips, Fish 
Tacos, mini Meat Pie and Sausage Rolls.  Every item was excellent as were the wedge fries and cole slaw.  Fantastic service as well.

No doubt we will be back, perhaps when they have some entertainment.

Shakespeare's is a solid 3 (I'd give 3.5 if I could, but would not go as high as 4). We come at least a couple times a month for trivia, which they do on Tues & Weds every week. Their service is always friendly, their food is acceptable but not great (with a menu that varied it's hard to do half of it really spot on; so far, the best things we've tried have been the meat pies; they're pretty delicious, as well as the chips & curry), and they have a good draught & bottled beer selection with a lot of craft offerings. I'm not sure many people order the craft beers there, though, because it doesn't seem like their inventory turns over very often. We've gotten a couple of expired bottles, and a handful of draughts that tasted fairly stale and/or bottom-of-the-barrel-y. It's a decently pleasant place, though, & it's pretty centrally located if you live in Henderson or Southeast Vegas.

Great place! Love the atmosphere, love the servers, love the food and drinks! Food can be a tiny bit pricier than comparable places, but I think it's worth coming here over somewhere else. Cool pub atmosphere with darts, billiard table, and TVs galore (ALWAYS have soccer on in addition to the more mainstream NFL, NBA, NHL and they'll put whatever you want on if they have the channel). Tons of beer on tap, delicious fish sandwich, big ol fat "fries" (potato wedges). They even do a Pub Quiz on Wednesday nights at 7:00pm!

Went here to watch the World Cup 2014.
Service?  There was none.  Complete and utter failure.
We actually tried to go to see the US match, but was turned away because we didn't make reservations.  That was fine.  
This time we had reserved a table, but it didn't matter because the staff was completely unprepared for the event.   Kind of crazy since they are known to be a soccer viewing sports bar.  Rather disappointing.

Decided to check out Shakespeare's to shake things up for our weekly Pub Quiz night out. 

The food was so-so. We tried one of each of the happy hour options - fish taco, slider and chips. Nothing outstanding, but solid efforts. The slider is tiny for the $2 price tag. Tasty, but small. The chips and fish taco were a much more substantial size. They also had some beer specials that were pretty cheap. The other menu items looked pretty good, albeit slightly expensive for pub food. 

As for the Pub Quiz, we usually go to McMullan's every week, and before that Fado. This place pales in comparison to both. The quizmaster reads the questions out clearly, but the time between questions is insanely long. It took so long and our patience started wearing thin about halfway through. 

All in all, the place was just all right, but we'll be back because we have to spend our $25 gift card we won for placing third. Haha.

I had a short but great experience at Shakespeare's! I down the street from it for years but never stopped in. I'm in town visiting my best friend from high school and she told me she has since gone there a ton since we graduated and really likes it and that they had a great selection of beer. I'm in!
When she said they had a great selection of beer, she was right, it's huge! They had a beer (mother earth California creamin') that I had a hard time finding so that was so cool!
Bartenders were all really nice! Didn't interact with them too much, but really enjoyed the environment and the service.. And all the great beer they had to offer! I'll be back here when I'm in town visiting!

Outstanding place.  The food is great and the karaoke is fabulous.  However, because this is a British themed pub, the food won't be traditional.   But it's still awesome grub.  I woke up hung over and my throat was sore.  For sure signs of a great night....and I have the video to prove it....Amy Lee I am not but it's great to sing your heart out with your friends.  And the staff is great about getting you a cab - wink.
Great place with friendly and fun staff!! Busy atmosphere and fun quiz nights. The food is delicious and the cocktails are awesome!! Great selection of beer. Check it out!!

Do not order the Shepherds Pie for To-Go or delivery.
In fact it's probably best to not order this menu item at all. For $12.99 it's just not worth it.
On the menu it is listed as Minced beef and veggies topped with homemade mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes tasted like instant mashed potatoes. The peas are canned peas. I've tasted a better Shepherds Pie as a prepackaged meal from the store. And that in itself is disappointing.
